Hi Everyone,

How are you? As of Monday 3/21, the following questions were raised in class:

What do we have to do for the final project?

In 345 there will be four assignments with 10 steps each for the following: 

Integrated Networking Systems; 

Dynamic Decision Making; 

Complex Adaptive Structures; 

Unique Innovative Capabilities.

The above four are the characteristics of successful global businesses.

In 448, there will be Hofstede’s Four Cultural Dimensions which I will write to you about, and there are four films for to be watched, which will be sent to you. You will be decoding and deconstructing words spoken in the films and interpret them in terms of Hofstede’s cross-cultural dimensions.

Steps for completing the above will be laid out in great length and detail in the following weeks.

Completing the project will not take time. Understanding it, always does.

Are we meeting in person for the rest of the semester? Days/times?

Yes and No. We are blending it as we see fit. We meet tomorrow Wednesday and then meet again on Monday. The meeting is open to those have questions and doubts and fears. We meet for clarifying what is going on with the letters. What are the questions regarding your reality in the fishbowl? The goal is to be happy in a learning environment.

In a nutshell, our meetings are not mandatory and attendance is not taken.

Not sure how many posts we have to post to the fishbowl or are we graded by the quality of our posts?

Both quantity and quality counts. You are graded on both. My advice: do as many as you can and give them your best shot. Your reflections (postings in the fishbowl) are your resource going forward. Building your resources requires daily immersion in text. Immerse yourselves in a textual reality for fifteen minutes every day. This practice should help you in other courses and activities. The fact that you can read each others postings gives you a good idea as to where you stand with regard to your grade. Your grade will not be a surprise to you, I assure you.

If fishbowl post are later than when email/letter was sent, does that affect your grade?

What affects your grade is consistency. If you do your work on a regular basis, you will get a higher grade than if you do it all at the end. The reason is because you are trying to create added value for your viewers in the moment. It is creating community, society and culture whenever we post our thoughts in-formation, fluid and flexible. It is how money is made.

For the vocabulary section, we use our own personal definitions for the words? I have been doing that but I. just wanted to make sure. Thank you!

The more creative you are with your personal definitions the better off you will be. The meaning of our words is what the jamboree is about. We can think about words, and we can image them, and we can feel them.

Lis of due dates for assignments (upcoming) if there will be specific ones we need to do. Announcement for when final is due.

You are to keep up with the letters going forward. Don’t let them pile up. Finish them before the week is out, and think of the next one. I will guide you in the letters as to what you have to do specifically. Just do it right then. Smash it. Stay on top of it. Slam it. You’re hooked in any event! Final is the last day of class. By then, you will have done what the letters asked you to do and so you are finally finished with words and reflections and felt-experiences in the fishbowl. Print out hard copies for your archives.

What should be my goal for the end of the course?

Good question. Be a hero whenever an idea or concept is trapped in the brain. Recurring goal: how to release an inner thought into the outer space of the world at the right time with enough nourishment so it will survive, make contact, explore---without being frightened down or fused with anything else.

i know we shouldn’t care right away about grades but i would really like an A in this class and I’m not sure if I am on that track or not.

It is too early to tell. So long as you are regularly decoding and deconstructing the letters (vocabulary, google searches, felt-experiences) you are on track.

How often should we complete a felt-experience?

As often as you can. They are fragments. They are moments captured in text. It is your learning space. The larger the space, the higher the grade. The world applauds such people and showers them with goods.

I’m a bit confused on the reflection/felt experience part of the fishbowl if you could explain a bit more it would be much appreciated.

Bottom line: you select a word, and describe your image of that word. This activity entails reflection (looking at yourself) and felt-experiencing (description of your image). 

When you relate or juxtapose two different words, you get yourself an interesting canvas. Creativity is the name of the game in business.

Just to clarify, submitting vocabulary at any time before classes end will earn at least a B?

Technically that is correct. The answer is Yes. What is expected is that you are regular in deciphering the letters. It is your money. I often go to the gym just to take a shower.

What project we will be working on after this? Will there be any deadline on fishbowl from now?

You will be given detail instructions for completing the project the entire month of April. The only deadline is regularity and the last day of class.

When will we know how we are doing (our grade) in the class?

The fishbowl is designed in such a way that the participant can tell themselves. If you are doing both vocabulary and google searches, you can expect a B+. Anything above that is difficult to tell at this point. Grades have generally met student expectations. There are no surprises.

Is there a certain deadline for all of the fishbowl posts?

The last day of class. The fishbowl will be officially closed after that. However, you will continue to have access.

Is there a rubric or grading guidelines that I can use to reassure myself that I am doing work in the fishbowl correctly?

For those who need reassurance must come to class. I will have my laptop, and you can email me right there and then and I will take a look.

Yes, you choose them from the letters and/or from your own text in the fishbowl. You choose them pretty much from anywhere.

There is no paper. Only the deconstruction steps which will be discussed threadbare going forward.

What groups are we supposed to be working with and can we choose to work alone? Is it the 3 names together by our last names in the fishbowl?

Yes, this is your group. There will be points when you will have to connect by reading the other’s text, but most of your work is done and posted alone.`

Be regular in your letter responses and follow instructions. Last day of class the fishbowl comes to an end.

I will post them on starfish.

I generally let you know. But you can always go further and pick your own.

Post by allisonmogauro » Mon Feb 07, 2022 3:37 pm

After finishing up the concept of reflection...

I have noted just how important the concept of note-taking and note-making is. Note-taking is a way to write down what you hear, while note-making is a way to consume what you hear. It is essential in the world of academics to do both of these things. They are important to the development of the student and even in the workforce. 

Another thing this concept has taught me is how experiences we go through are interpreted by us by our perception. It is up to you if your experiences are negative or positive. For instance, after crashing my car and I could have taken this as a bad experience. However, it made me become a better, more careful driver, making the overall experience a positive one in my opinion. When I think about it, instead of having regrets, I know I need to take it provisionally. I must start doing this with other experiences.

This goes along with the idea of becoming by Deleuze. Only you can live life to your full potential if you let yourself. You must let yourself be free in order to live life in the best way possible. Ignoring judgment is essential in order to live how you want. However, living how you want depends on you, no one else. You must take a situation and look at it in the best possible way or take an outcome and see it in the most positive way as possible.

Post by allisonmogauro » Mon Feb 07, 2022 8:53 pm

From the letter "About not being confused"

"But it is you who has to eat your vegetables (metaphor). I can’t eat them for you! That is a hard lesson."

It is important that as a student, you do the things you may not want to in order to succeed. In essence, it is like getting out of your comfort zone. To reach your full potential as a student, you must feel uncomfortable at some moments. 

Discomfort is a sign of progress- it helps the person grow and adapt. It is a normal and healthy part of life. When you are growing up, at some point you need to start doing things on your own. If you do not, you will forever be dependent and it can affect you later in life. Being dependent can affect your relationships negatively, as you can put stress on your partner/friend on relying on them too much.

Post by allisonmogauro » Tue Feb 08, 2022 8:25 pm

"About Deconstruction" letter

"Deconstruction is “a method of interpretation” or rather textual INTERPRETATION, i.e., interpreting words by looking up the meaning from the dictionary."

In my mind, deconstruction is looking at words deeper than just the letters. It is looking at the ideas behind the words and why the writer is writing them. It is easier in person to listen to someone talk because you can see their emotions and voice tone to figure out what they are saying. However, when someone writes, the reader can have trouble deciding what the writer is trying to say. This is because writers can have different ideas than a reader. 

For instance, a writer can be writing about a character that in their eyes is mad, but the reader can have no idea and think they were happy. this is because the reader cannot see emotion. To me, emotion helps a lot in showing the meaning behind words. Ideas make up words and words makeup stories, therefore deconstruction is very important while reading. Deconstruction is just as important as interpretation due to the fact that words are not just letters.

Post by allisonmogauro » Wed Feb 09, 2022 6:53 pm

"The challenge of learning" letter

"Our memory is a repository of feelings, felt in past situations (experiences) that we are evoking in the present."

Memories are not based on words, but they are based on how you felt in that moment. For instance, if you remember a good memory like when you went on vacation with your friends, you remember how happy and excited you were. You do not remember the exact experience and everything that was said, but just how you felt. The same goes with a bad experience. Especially in a traumatic experience, you will not remember the exact words or phrases that you heard, but instead how sorrowful, depressed, or miserable you were. Feelings are the core to our memories and are felt even in the present when thinking about the past.

allisonmogauro

Posts: 56

Joined: Mon Jan 24, 2022 10:20 am

Post by allisonmogauro » Mon Feb 21, 2022 5:07 pm

GROWTH: a stage or condition in increasing, developing, or maturing. Synonyms are maturing, or broadening. Growth is focused on self and development. In education, growth refers to how much students grow in their proficiency in the school system. To grow as a person, you must not make excuses, compliment yourself, be helpful, and practice forgiveness. As humans, we grow every day whether we notice it or not. Whether it be big or small steps, we develop even the slightest bit daily. In the fishbowl, we are experiencing growth in our vocabulary as well as our thoughts and realities. 

DISCIPLINE: to train or develop by instruction and exercise, especially in self-control. A person who is disciplined is true to their word; when they decide to do something, they set themselves accountable. Self-disciplined people stay motivated and are able to push themselves to grow. Synonyms are strictness. routine, and control. In the fishbowl, it is essential to have discipline and complete the work although there is no due date and the class is online. if you are disciplined in the fishbowl, you will grow. 

INTEGRITY: Synonyms: honor, morals. The quality of being honest and having strong morals. Showing integrity means keeping secrets, being honest with friends and family, not gossiping, and following through with promises. Someone who shows integrity means someone who has guidelines that they live by. In the fishbowl, one must show integrity by making themselves learn something new every day. We as students make a promise to ourselves to learn everyday, therefore we must continue to be honest with ourselves and show integrity by putting in the effort.

Post by allisonmogauro » Mon Mar 21, 2022 8:59 pm

“Reaching across cultures through reflections in a fishbowl” letter

Words: win/practice

Word pool: gain, secure, achieve, collect

Practices- exercise, apply, utilize, application

Sentence: Through practice, determination, willpower, and grit, you can win any test that comes your way. 

Felt experience: Being an athlete, I have realized the importance of practice. However, it is what you put into practice that is the most important. Being focused and working hard during the time you are working helps what you get out of practice. I have realized this goes the same for any situation, education especially. The amount I spend studying for a test has a severe impact on just how well I do on that test. Another instance is in the fishbowl. You must practice your vocabulary and reflections in order to understand and grasp concepts. The more time you spend practicing in the fishbowl, the more you will understand the ideas.

Post by allisonmogauro » Mon Mar 21, 2022 10:08 pm

"Meeting in real time on Monday" letter

appointed/represents

word pool: 

appointed: scheduled, arranged, determined, chosen

represents: replaces, elects, acts, plays 

sentence: The appointed captain represents the leader for the team, who is to treat all teammates fairly while inspiring them. 

Felt experience: 

On most teams, there is an appointed captain. Sometimes the captain is chosen by the coaches while other times they are chosen by their teammates. This person is a representation of the team. A captain is supposed to be someone you look up to. These people also should give 100% in all practices and games. In general in life, people are captains. For instance, people are born followers or leaders. People who are followers avoid guilt if something goes wrong, while leaders are ready to take the blame. It is about willingness to be wrong. I believe I am somewhere in the middle. I am not aggressive enough to be a leader and try to avoid conflicts. However, I do not like to sit back and be told what to do. In this sense, I am a leader because I take initiative. Leaders possess qualities such as being self-aware, having empathy, having good communication skills, and respect. Followers have good judgment, competence, courage, and loyalty. Both have qualities that everyone should strive to possess.

Not sure how many posts we have to post to the fishbowl or are we graded by the quality of our posts?

Both quantity and quality counts. You are graded on both. My advice: do as many as you can and give them your best shot. Your reflections (postings in the fishbowl) are your resource going forward. Building your resources requires daily immersion in text. Immerse yourselves in a textual reality for fifteen minutes every day. This practice should help you in other courses and activities. The fact that you can read each others postings gives you a good idea as to where you stand with regard to your grade. Your grade will not be a surprise to you, I assure you.

If fishbowl post are later than when email/letter was sent, does that affect your grade?

What affects your grade is consistency. If you do your work on a regular basis, you will get a higher grade than if you do it all at the end. The reason is because you are trying to create added value for your viewers in the moment. It is creating community, society and culture whenever we post our thoughts in-formation, fluid and flexible. It is how money is made.

For the vocabulary section, we use our own personal definitions for the words? I have been doing that but I. just wanted to make sure. Thank you!

The more creative you are with your personal definitions the better off you will be. The meaning of our words is what the jamboree is about. We can think about words, and we can image them, and we can feel them.

Lis of due dates for assignments (upcoming) if there will be specific ones we need to do. Announcement for when final is due.

You are to keep up with the letters going forward. Don’t let them pile up. Finish them before the week is out, and think of the next one. I will guide you in the letters as to what you have to do specifically. Just do it right then. Smash it. Stay on top of it. Slam it. You’re hooked in any event! Final is the last day of class. By then, you will have done what the letters asked you to do and so you are finally finished with words and reflections and felt-experiences in the fishbowl. Print out hard copies for your archives.

What should be my goal for the end of the course?

Good question. Be a hero whenever an idea or concept is trapped in the brain. Recurring goal: how to release an inner thought into the outer space of the world at the right time with enough nourishment so it will survive, make contact, explore---without being frightened down or fused with anything else.

i know we shouldn’t care right away about grades but i would really like an A in this class and I’m not sure if I am on that track or not.

It is too early to tell. So long as you are regularly decoding and deconstructing the letters (vocabulary, google searches, felt-experiences) you are on track.

How often should we complete a felt-experience?

As often as you can. They are fragments. They are moments captured in text. It is your learning space. The larger the space, the higher the grade. The world applauds such people and showers them with goods.

I’m a bit confused on the reflection/felt experience part of the fishbowl if you could explain a bit more it would be much appreciated.

Bottom line: you select a word, and describe your image of that word. This activity entails reflection (looking at yourself) and felt-experiencing (description of your image). 

When you relate or juxtapose two different words, you get yourself an interesting canvas. Creativity is the name of the game in business.

Just to clarify, submitting vocabulary at any time before classes end will earn at least a B?

Technically that is correct. The answer is Yes. What is expected is that you are regular in deciphering the letters. It is your money. I often go to the gym just to take a shower.

What project we will be working on after this? Will there be any deadline on fishbowl from now?

You will be given detail instructions for completing the project the entire month of April. The only deadline is regularity and the last day of class.

When will we know how we are doing (our grade) in the class?

The fishbowl is designed in such a way that the participant can tell themselves. If you are doing both vocabulary and google searches, you can expect a B+. Anything above that is difficult to tell at this point. Grades have generally met student expectations. There are no surprises.

Is there a certain deadline for all of the fishbowl posts?

The last day of class. The fishbowl will be officially closed after that. However, you will continue to have access.

Is there a rubric or grading guidelines that I can use to reassure myself that I am doing work in the fishbowl correctly?

For those who need reassurance must come to class. I will have my laptop, and you can email me right there and then and I will take a look.

I am still confused about thought-felt experiences, is it words we choose from the letters to analyze?

Yes, you choose them from the letters and/or from your own text in the fishbowl. You choose them pretty much from anywhere.

 Is the final just deconstructing those 4 questions or are turning that into a paper?

There is no paper. Only the deconstruction steps which will be discussed threadbare going forward.

What groups are we supposed to be working with and can we choose to work alone? Is it the 3 names together by our last names in the fishbowl?

Yes, this is your group. There will be points when you will have to connect by reading the other’s text, but most of your work is done and posted alone.`

What is due when?

Be regular in your letter responses and follow instructions. Last day of class the fishbowl comes to an end.

I fell behind at some points due to personal reasons, will that effect my grade if I don't post my response every day?

No it should not, so long as you get back on track.

How do we see our grades?

I will post them on starfish.

Is there certain places we put our felt experiences or do we put them with any word we feel a connection with?

You can organize your postings in whatever way it works for you.

For felt experiences, how do we pick out within the letters what to use?

I generally let you know. But you can always go further and pick your own. 

Can you go over Edulearn22?

That is a conference we are submitting our fishbowl process for review.

Where do we put our deconstructed/substituted words/sentences within the fishbowl?

You are free to organize it the way it works for you. I will get to see it.

Will grades be posted?

Not in the fishbowl. Your grade is your private affair and sent to you by the university.

Is B the lowest grade you give?

Yes.

Is in person participation mandatory?

No

Will we be given a heads up on our current class grade?

Yes.

If others in our group are not active how should we complete group project.

You will manage alone without your grade being affected. Your experience will be different.

If there are repeat vocab words are we supposed to find synonyms of those vocab words?

The key is to expand your understanding of the word.

Can I still get an A in the class if I start posting regularly now?

YES.

When are we assigned the movies to watch?

Coming up shortly. Beginning this week.

What are the 3 most important things you look for in the fishbowl?

Regularity.

Depth of thoughts.

Descriptions of experiences.

Does the class have exams?

NO

How does this class relate to business in society?

We are looking at society as the following: digital, textual, symbolic, embodied.

We are experiencing it through participant observation, symbolic exchanges, social reflexivity and sharing of ideas.

Doing business in society in the 21st is about doing this. It is how we make money now.

Sanjiv

Post by allisonmogauro » Mon Feb 07, 2022 3:37 pm

After finishing up the concept of reflection...

I have noted just how important the concept of note-taking and note-making is. Note-taking is a way to write down what you hear, while note-making is a way to consume what you hear. It is essential in the world of academics to do both of these things. They are important to the development of the student and even in the workforce. 

Another thing this concept has taught me is how experiences we go through are interpreted by us by our perception. It is up to you if your experiences are negative or positive. For instance, after crashing my car and I could have taken this as a bad experience. However, it made me become a better, more careful driver, making the overall experience a positive one in my opinion. When I think about it, instead of having regrets, I know I need to take it provisionally. I must start doing this with other experiences.

This goes along with the idea of becoming by Deleuze. Only you can live life to your full potential if you let yourself. You must let yourself be free in order to live life in the best way possible. Ignoring judgment is essential in order to live how you want. However, living how you want depends on you, no one else. You must take a situation and look at it in the best possible way or take an outcome and see it in the most positive way as possible.

Post by allisonmogauro » Mon Feb 07, 2022 8:53 pm

From the letter "About not being confused"

"But it is you who has to eat your vegetables (metaphor). I can’t eat them for you! That is a hard lesson."

It is important that as a student, you do the things you may not want to in order to succeed. In essence, it is like getting out of your comfort zone. To reach your full potential as a student, you must feel uncomfortable at some moments. 

Discomfort is a sign of progress- it helps the person grow and adapt. It is a normal and healthy part of life. When you are growing up, at some point you need to start doing things on your own. If you do not, you will forever be dependent and it can affect you later in life. Being dependent can affect your relationships negatively, as you can put stress on your partner/friend on relying on them too much.

Post by allisonmogauro » Tue Feb 08, 2022 8:25 pm

"About Deconstruction" letter

"Deconstruction is “a method of interpretation” or rather textual INTERPRETATION, i.e., interpreting words by looking up the meaning from the dictionary."

In my mind, deconstruction is looking at words deeper than just the letters. It is looking at the ideas behind the words and why the writer is writing them. It is easier in person to listen to someone talk because you can see their emotions and voice tone to figure out what they are saying. However, when someone writes, the reader can have trouble deciding what the writer is trying to say. This is because writers can have different ideas than a reader. 

For instance, a writer can be writing about a character that in their eyes is mad, but the reader can have no idea and think they were happy. this is because the reader cannot see emotion. To me, emotion helps a lot in showing the meaning behind words. Ideas make up words and words makeup stories, therefore deconstruction is very important while reading. Deconstruction is just as important as interpretation due to the fact that words are not just letters.

Post by allisonmogauro » Wed Feb 09, 2022 6:53 pm

"The challenge of learning" letter

"Our memory is a repository of feelings, felt in past situations (experiences) that we are evoking in the present."

Memories are not based on words, but they are based on how you felt in that moment. For instance, if you remember a good memory like when you went on vacation with your friends, you remember how happy and excited you were. You do not remember the exact experience and everything that was said, but just how you felt. The same goes with a bad experience. Especially in a traumatic experience, you will not remember the exact words or phrases that you heard, but instead how sorrowful, depressed, or miserable you were. Feelings are the core to our memories and are felt even in the present when thinking about the past.

allisonmogauro

Joined: Mon Jan 24, 2022 10:20 am

Post by allisonmogauro » Mon Feb 21, 2022 5:07 pm

GROWTH: a stage or condition in increasing, developing, or maturing. Synonyms are maturing, or broadening. Growth is focused on self and development. In education, growth refers to how much students grow in their proficiency in the school system. To grow as a person, you must not make excuses, compliment yourself, be helpful, and practice forgiveness. As humans, we grow every day whether we notice it or not. Whether it be big or small steps, we develop even the slightest bit daily. In the fishbowl, we are experiencing growth in our vocabulary as well as our thoughts and realities. 

DISCIPLINE: to train or develop by instruction and exercise, especially in self-control. A person who is disciplined is true to their word; when they decide to do something, they set themselves accountable. Self-disciplined people stay motivated and are able to push themselves to grow. Synonyms are strictness. routine, and control. In the fishbowl, it is essential to have discipline and complete the work although there is no due date and the class is online. if you are disciplined in the fishbowl, you will grow. 

INTEGRITY: Synonyms: honor, morals. The quality of being honest and having strong morals. Showing integrity means keeping secrets, being honest with friends and family, not gossiping, and following through with promises. Someone who shows integrity means someone who has guidelines that they live by. In the fishbowl, one must show integrity by making themselves learn something new every day. We as students make a promise to ourselves to learn everyday, therefore we must continue to be honest with ourselves and show integrity by putting in the effort.

Post by allisonmogauro » Mon Mar 21, 2022 8:59 pm

“Reaching across cultures through reflections in a fishbowl” letter

Words: win/practice

Word pool: gain, secure, achieve, collect

Practices- exercise, apply, utilize, application

Sentence: Through practice, determination, willpower, and grit, you can win any test that comes your way. 

Felt experience: Being an athlete, I have realized the importance of practice. However, it is what you put into practice that is the most important. Being focused and working hard during the time you are working helps what you get out of practice. I have realized this goes the same for any situation, education especially. The amount I spend studying for a test has a severe impact on just how well I do on that test. Another instance is in the fishbowl. You must practice your vocabulary and reflections in order to understand and grasp concepts. The more time you spend practicing in the fishbowl, the more you will understand the ideas.

Post by allisonmogauro » Mon Mar 21, 2022 10:08 pm

"Meeting in real time on Monday" letter

appointed/represents

word pool: 

appointed: scheduled, arranged, determined, chosen

represents: replaces, elects, acts, plays 

sentence: The appointed captain represents the leader for the team, who is to treat all teammates fairly while inspiring them. 

Felt experience: 

On most teams, there is an appointed captain. Sometimes the captain is chosen by the coaches while other times they are chosen by their teammates. This person is a representation of the team. A captain is supposed to be someone you look up to. These people also should give 100% in all practices and games. In general in life, people are captains. For instance, people are born followers or leaders. People who are followers avoid guilt if something goes wrong, while leaders are ready to take the blame. It is about willingness to be wrong. I believe I am somewhere in the middle. I am not aggressive enough to be a leader and try to avoid conflicts. However, I do not like to sit back and be told what to do. In this sense, I am a leader because I take initiative. Leaders possess qualities such as being self-aware, having empathy, having good communication skills, and respect. Followers have good judgment, competence, courage, and loyalty. Both have qualities that everyone should strive to possess.

The conference deadline for the Abstract is shifted to 3/31. Please see attached. If you wish to have your name on (or off) the abstract, you must show evidence of work completed before 3/31, I will be happy to include your name as co-author. Seize the day, as they say!

I have registered for the conference (around $500) to ensure the co-authors a digital footprint in the published proceedings. - Publish your paper in EDULEARN22 Proceedings.

Registered virtual authors will receive a virtual package (EDULEARN22 Proceedings, participation/author certificate, and conference materials) that will be sent by courier after the conference dates.

In order to promote a maximum interaction, different thematic chats, private chats and other networking live activities will be offered for virtual participants.

Date: 3/1/2022 13:37:30
Subject: feedback again
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

From your constructed dichotomy, you are creating a sentence structure. 

This sentence has to include both words of the dichotomy.

Not one word at a time, but both words, simultaneously, are to form the sentence.

You are taking each of the two words in the dichotomy further, by looking up their meaning in the dictionary (word pool), so that you can substitute the original choice of words in your dichotomy and thereby, easily create a sentence.

You are fitting a felt-experience to this sentence.

Only then you are creating original knowledge content.

You don’t have to get it perfect and you don’t have to share a perfect finished outcome. 

Show all your work and the change in sentence structures as you construct them, and the choice of your selections and the reason why you make them. 

Transparency and sharing your trajectory of thoughts has become a key skill for leadership and management. Please keep that in mind.

Fear of getting it wrong and not getting it right is an inhibiting factor. Drop the fear. Wasted emotion in a learning environment.

Sincerity and integrity and focus are of value.

Sanjiv

Date: 3/1/2022 3:15:06
Subject: feedback: singular juxtapositions and structural spaces
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

Please see Emmanuel Bazile’s exercise below.

Bazile's dichotomies are challenging juxtapositions of two word-images; two concepts; two symbols; two ideas; two words.

They are unique and only he could have chosen them. They have never been combined in this way. They are singular.

Singularity is a central aspect of globalization (please google Empire by Hardt and Negri).

These dichotomies are an assemblage, they are singular and a central aspect of the multitude which is us in the fishbowl.. 

1. conformity/opinion

2. transparent/initiative

3. ability/aspect

Feedback:

The word-pool should consist of both words in the dichotomies from which you will form a sentence structure. 

Not just one word, ‘conformity,' but both: ‘conformity' and ‘opinion.'

The new sentence structure should be formed from this inclusive and enhanced word pool that includes both words of the dichotomies.

Whenever you FORM a sentence structure emanating from both words in your dichotomy, and fit a felt-experience to it, you are creating a new knowing and knowledge content.

Emmanuel Bazile’s posting is an excellent first attempt. It gets him an A-minus. He must aim for an A and create original knowledge content. 

Aside:

I am looking at every word you post and I think about you all the time. I hold back to give you space to develop your thoughts, words and images.

I am waiting and watching your postings to inspire and enable me to write the Abstracts for EDULEARN22 (please google). The deadline is looming.

Always follow the KISS principle.

We will soon distinguish MGT345 and MGT448 and start watching films. 

Sanjiv

SINGULAR, JUXTAPOSITION, ASSEMBLAGE, MULTITUDE, EMANATE, (Please google EMPIRE BY HARDT AND NEGRI)

Words from paragraph on Discipline 

1. conformity

2. opinions

Conformity is defined as the compliance with standards, rules, or laws. 

Similar words and phrases are adherence, accordance with, observance, orthodoxy, obedience, allegiance, submission.

Relative to the definition of conformity, a example is a student who changes the style in which they dress because they want to look like their peers. To this extent, why do people conform? To fit in, pressure, embarrassment. 

A sentence example is "You must conform to the laws in order to have the privileges as a citizen."

Felt experience: A time I experienced conformity was when I used to do ballet. I remember the teachers stressing on reciprocating their form, positions, posture. It was as the saying, its either their way or the highway. If you did not do what they wanted, looked how they wanted in regards to weight/height, or correct techniques, they would kick you out the class. As students we had to do what they wanted, observe and repeat without input. 

Rigorous is defined as extremely thorough, exhaustive or accurate.

Similar words are meticulous, punctilious, conscientious, attentive.

Relative to the definition, rigorous implies to the imposition of hardship or difficulty. Consider an exam or physical test. 

A sentence example is "The rigors testing of consumer products."

Felt experience: Of all the times I have been challenged, I feel the most memorable rigorous experience was when I did a police academy for a summer. When I was younger I wanted to go work in the FBI or secret service, so I did a summer program where I was exposed to people I that field. I was able to meet and do training exercises with air Marshalls, fire fighters, SWAT teams, CIA and other areas of law enforcement. However, the beginning of each day began with physical training in which we would run miles and miles through trails in the woods and on the roads. Then return to do push ups, sit-ups, pull ups and exhausting excerucses. I remember this one time I was exhausted because I also have asthma, and after a run going into pushups we had to hit a certain threshold a number of certain exercises then finish drink all the water in our bottles and hold it over our heads. I remember people throwing up and just a mess, and the only thing going through my head was when I was able to go home.

emmanuelbazile

Posts: 25

Joined: Mon Jan 31, 2022 8:02 am

 emmanuelbazile » Mon Feb 28, 2022 5:38 pm

Words on paragraph from Integrity

1. Transparent

2. Initiative

Transparent is defined as allowing light to pass through so that objects behind can be distinctly seen or having thoughts, feelings, or motives that are easily perceived.

Similar words are see-through, clear, pellucid.

Relative to the definition, I interpret transparent as being clear and explicit of the truth. 

A sentence example is "He was transparent about his feelings towards his girlfriend."

Felt experience related to the word transparent: I feel in most situations I am a transparent person. In regard to speaking how I feel despite it contradicting how others feel or believe. For example, if I think something is wrong, or don't agree with something, I will listen to the other party fully and then voice my point at the end. Additionally, I learned that to be straightforward, despite it not being the best thing to say or do. If I don't know how to do something, or if I feel something should be done, I will acknowledge it and speak up. 

Initiative is defined as the ability to assess and initiate things independently.

Similar words are resourcefulness, capability, lead, edge.

Relative to the definition, initiative refers to act or take charge before others do.

A sentence example is "She took initiative to start the group project early."

A felt experience related to initiative I can often think of is working in group projects. Every group project I have done, epically when the professor makes the groups, no one communicates with one another till last minute of when its due. I see and experience this pattern all the time, and have changed my approach by taking initiative. Especially the last two semesters, I am often the person to initiative the communication between everyone in the group and organize/structure the project for people in my group.

Words on paragraph from Growth

1. Ability

2. Aspect

Ability is defined as the possession of the means or skill to do something.

Similar words are capacity, capability, potential, power.

Relative to the definition, ability means the physical, mental, or legal power to do something.

A sentence example is "An employee has the ability to fire their employees."

Felt experience: When I think of ability and how it relates to my experiences, I consider my physical and mental abilities. To be healthy both physically and mentally to do activities, experience certain things others cannot do due disabilities or financial circumstances. 

Aspect is defined as a particular part or feature of something.

Similar words are featured facet, side, characteristic.

Relative to the definition, aspect refers to how something looks or when something is happening. 

A sentence example is "The house has a dark and aesthetic aspect look to it at night."

A felt experience related to aspect that I often think of when I see the word aspect is identity. Interpreting aspect as features, characteristics, I relate it to identity and individuality. Of what makes you different, culture, religion, community etc.

Subject: feedback: singular juxtapositions and structural spaces
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

Please see Emmanuel Bazile’s exercise below.

Bazile's dichotomies are challenging juxtapositions of two word-images; two concepts; two symbols; two ideas; two words.

They are unique and only he could have chosen them. They have never been combined in this way. They are singular.

Singularity is a central aspect of globalization (please google Empire by Hardt and Negri).

These dichotomies are an assemblage, they are singular and a central aspect of the multitude which is us in the fishbowl.. 

1. conformity/opinion

2. transparent/initiative

3. ability/aspect

Feedback:

The word-pool should consist of both words in the dichotomies from which you will form a sentence structure. 

Not just one word, ‘conformity,' but both: ‘conformity' and ‘opinion.'

The new sentence structure should be formed from this inclusive and enhanced word pool that includes both words of the dichotomies.

Whenever you FORM a sentence structure emanating from both words in your dichotomy, and fit a felt-experience to it, you are creating a new knowing and knowledge content.

Emmanuel Bazile’s posting is an excellent first attempt. It gets him an A-minus. He must aim for an A and create original knowledge content. 

Aside:

I am looking at every word you post and I think about you all the time. I hold back to give you space to develop your thoughts, words and images.

I am waiting and watching your postings to inspire and enable me to write the Abstracts for EDULEARN22 (please google). The deadline is looming.

Always follow the KISS principle.

We will soon distinguish MGT345 and MGT448 and start watching films. 

Sanjiv

Date: 2/27/2022 23:07:06
Subject: Regarding Exercise: Assess Your Learning Through Self-Realization
------------------------------------------------------------
Good Evening Jason,

Thank you for your email. 

The exercise is to show that we learn through self-realization.

The dictionary tells us, to realize something imagined is to convert it into real existence or fact.

1. 

Pick two words from your reflection written on the word Discipline.

That is, go to your paragraph on Discipline.

Randomly select two words from your paragraph and put them side by side and create a dichotomy.

The two words must not be related in any way. So don’t pick blue/sky or green/grass or good/boy.

If the two words are related, your realization is trivial and commonplace. 

2.

Deconstruct the words in your dichotomy.

I am presuming you know how to do that.

That is, from the dictionary and thesaurus, take your two words further by sorting, sifting, and selecting words and create a pool of words.

From this pool of words, construct a sentence.

If you are not satisfied with your constructed sentence, deconstruct the words in your pool further, that is, take the words further, until you create a sentence that you like.

This sentence is an abstraction. There is no first person in it. No Jason in it. It is a generalization.

3. 

Fit a felt-experience to your constructed and created sentence.

The felt-experience is a personal experience from your past. It is your reflection.

4. 

Do the same process for your paragraphs on Growth and Integrity.

I hope my clarification helps. It is like a word-game.

It is to be simple, satisfying and original to you.

It will be a learning experience for your readers and viewers.

It is being a leader, an innovator, and an educator.

Best wishes. I hope you are keeping well.

Sanjiv

From: Sanjiv Dugal

Sent: Thursday, February 24, 2022 7:12 AM

To: Sanjiv Dugal

Subject: Exercise: Assess Your Learning Through Self-Realization

 

Hi Everyone,

How do we assess our learning through realization?

The How So question. I follow the same procedure that you are being asked to do, and wrap-up a procedure for the Abstract for EDULEARN22. PLease pay close attention and follow the procedure for yourself and post in the fishbowl.

I. Looking up Meaning of Words

First, look up the meaning of REALIZATION and write it down, so that you know what is being asked.

The Oxford English Dictionary defines the word "realise" (also spelt "realize") as "to convert (something imagined, planned, etc.) into real existence or fact.”

In linguistics, realization is the process by which some kind of SURFACE REPRESENTATION is derived from its UNDERLYING representation; that is, the way in which some abstract object of linguistic analysis comes to be produced in actual language. 

Realization is also a subtask of 'natural language generation' (NLG), which involves creating an actual text in a human language (English, French, etc.) from a syntactic (SYNTAX) representation. There are a number of software packages available for realization, most of which have been developed by academic research groups in NLG (please google). 

Also, have the meaning of Assess and Learning at hand from the previous letter, if you haven’t already done so.

II. Steps for Making Sense

I have copied out Julia DiGrazia’s posting below as an example, and I am going to “play” the role of Julia, and address the question: what have I realized from my felt experience and knowledge creation of the word: Integrity. In the words from above, what is the underlying representation of her text? How was her actual text produced from a syntactic representation?

"Integrity: Integrity can be defined as, the quality of moral consistency, honesty and truthfulness with oneself and others. Integrity is all about being honest and morals and that is why I feel as though this definition describes the word best. Integrity is a very deep and powerful word and I feel that is can be described in many different ways. In a way, integrity appeals to my emotions. (Julia DiGrazia, Spring, 2021)

I randomly select two words from her paragraph above and write them down as a DICHOTOMY. Tip: the selected words should be different from each other and not related. NO adjectives and words that challenge you to construct meaning by putting them side by side

Moral Consistency/Emotions. 

I create this dichotomy intuitively, for there is no right nor wrong. I am to make-sense of the words in the dichotomy and their association, aka “sense-making.” (Please google KARL WEICK AND SENSE-MAKING). 

I go into the dictionary and deconstruct both words of my self-generated dichotomy, and put them together into a self-constucted structure of words. 

Finally, from this self-constructed structure of words, I ‘fit' a felt-experience and make-sense of what I have realized.

III. Example of Exercise

moral consistency/emotion

moral:

1. concerned with the principles of right and wrong behavior and the goodness or badness of human character

2. holding or manifesting high principles for proper conduct

consistency:

1. conformity in the application of something, typically that which is necessary for the sake of logic, accuracy, or fairness: the grading system is to be streamlined to ensure greater consistency. 

• the achievement of a level of performance that does not vary greatly in quality over time

emotion:

a natural instinctive state of mind deriving from one's circumstances, mood, or relationships with others: 

• instinctive or intuitive feeling as distinguished from reasoning or knowledge:

IV. Constructing, Creating Knowledge and a Knowing

I construct the following structure: 

"conforming to principles provides a space for instinctive feelings as distinguished from reasoning or knowledge.”

I take the words further from this structure, if need be, and create simpler structures through selection and substitution, until a felt-experience is naturally and easily evoked. 

Finally, I FIT my felt-experience to the final structure. This ‘fitting' is key if I don’t want my sense-making to be mumbo-jumbo.

"I stood in line at the coffee exchange, and when i reached the end of the line the conformity of choices allowed me to make a decision instinctly. I started out thinking I’d have a latte but had a dark roast instead."

“It’s like a simple word-game,” Julia said. “Yes, indeed,” Sanjiv replied.

Sanjiv

from the fishbowl...

Post by juliadigrazia » Tue Feb 22, 2022 11:20 pm

Growth: One definition of the word growth that I found that really stuck with me is, growth is defined as the potential to cultivate inner potentialities seek out optimal challenges and integrate new experiences into the self-concept. This definition for the word growth really puts the word into perspective and defines it in a way that makes sense and stands out from the other definitions. Other definitions of the word include the process of increasing in physical size and a stage or condition in increasing, developing or maturing. To me, those definitions are not as deep as the first one I mentioned. The first definition really stuck with me.

Discipline: A definition for the word discipline is, training that is designed to establish desired habits of mind and behavior. I really like this definition because when someone thinks of the word discipline this is definitely not the first definition that comes to mind for them. A definition that is more common is the practice of training people to obey rules or a code behavior by using punishment to correct disobedience. I am not a big fan of this definition and that is why I picked the first definition and why I like it so much.

Integrity: Integrity can be defined as, the quality of moral consistency, honesty and truthfulness with oneself and others. Integrity is all about being honest and morals and that is why I feel as though this definition describes the word best. Integrity is a very deep and powerful word and I feel that is can be described in many different ways. In a way, integrity appeals to my emotions.

I take the words further from this structure, if need be, and create simpler structures through selection and substitution, until a felt-experience is naturally and easily evoked. 

Finally, I FIT my felt-experience to the final structure. This ‘fitting' is key if I don’t want my sense-making to be mumbo-jumbo.

"I stood in line at the coffee exchange, and when i reached the end of the line the conformity of choices allowed me to make a decision instinctly. I started out thinking I’d have a latte but had a dark roast instead."

“It’s like a simple word-game,” Julia said. “Yes, indeed,” Sanjiv replied.

Sanjiv

Growth: One definition of the word growth that I found that really stuck with me is, growth is defined as the potential to cultivate inner potentialities seek out optimal challenges and integrate new experiences into the self-concept. This definition for the word growth really puts the word into perspective and defines it in a way that makes sense and stands out from the other definitions. Other definitions of the word include the process of increasing in physical size and a stage or condition in increasing, developing or maturing. To me, those definitions are not as deep as the first one I mentioned. The first definition really stuck with me.

Discipline: A definition for the word discipline is, training that is designed to establish desired habits of mind and behavior. I really like this definition because when someone thinks of the word discipline this is definitely not the first definition that comes to mind for them. A definition that is more common is the practice of training people to obey rules or a code behavior by using punishment to correct disobedience. I am not a big fan of this definition and that is why I picked the first definition and why I like it so much.

Integrity: Integrity can be defined as, the quality of moral consistency, honesty and truthfulness with oneself and others. Integrity is all about being honest and morals and that is why I feel as though this definition describes the word best. Integrity is a very deep and powerful word and I feel that is can be described in many different ways. In a way, integrity appeals to my emotions.

Date: 2/24/2022 12:13:03
Subject: Exercise: Assess Your Learning Through Self-Realization
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

How do we assess our learning through realization?

The How So question. I follow the same procedure that you are being asked to do, and wrap-up a procedure for the Abstract for EDULEARN22. PLease pay close attention and follow the procedure for yourself and post in the fishbowl.

I. Looking up Meaning of Words

First, look up the meaning of REALIZATION and write it down, so that you know what is being asked.

The Oxford English Dictionary defines the word "realise" (also spelt "realize") as "to convert (something imagined, planned, etc.) into real existence or fact.”

In linguistics, realization is the process by which some kind of SURFACE REPRESENTATION is derived from its UNDERLYING representation; that is, the way in which some abstract object of linguistic analysis comes to be produced in actual language. 

Realization is also a subtask of 'natural language generation' (NLG), which involves creating an actual text in a human language (English, French, etc.) from a syntactic (SYNTAX) representation. There are a number of software packages available for realization, most of which have been developed by academic research groups in NLG (please google). 

Also, have the meaning of Assess and Learning at hand from the previous letter, if you haven’t already done so.

II. Steps for Making Sense

I have copied out Julia DiGrazia’s posting below as an example, and I am going to “play” the role of Julia, and address the question: what have I realized from my felt experience and knowledge creation of the word: Integrity. In the words from above, what is the underlying representation of her text? How was her actual text produced from a syntactic representation?

"Integrity: Integrity can be defined as, the quality of moral consistency, honesty and truthfulness with oneself and others. Integrity is all about being honest and morals and that is why I feel as though this definition describes the word best. Integrity is a very deep and powerful word and I feel that is can be described in many different ways. In a way, integrity appeals to my emotions. (Julia DiGrazia, Spring, 2021)

I randomly select two words from her paragraph above and write them down as a DICHOTOMY. Tip: the selected words should be different from each other and not related. NO adjectives and words that challenge you to construct meaning by putting them side by side

Moral Consistency/Emotions. 

I create this dichotomy intuitively, for there is no right nor wrong. I am to make-sense of the words in the dichotomy and their association, aka “sense-making.” (Please google KARL WEICK AND SENSE-MAKING). 

I go into the dictionary and deconstruct both words of my self-generated dichotomy, and put them together into a self-constucted structure of words. 

Finally, from this self-constructed structure of words, I ‘fit' a felt-experience and make-sense of what I have realized.

III. Example of Exercise

moral consistency/emotion

moral:

1. concerned with the principles of right and wrong behavior and the goodness or badness of human character

2. holding or manifesting high principles for proper conduct

consistency:

1. conformity in the application of something, typically that which is necessary for the sake of logic, accuracy, or fairness: the grading system is to be streamlined to ensure greater consistency. 

• the achievement of a level of performance that does not vary greatly in quality over time

emotion:

a natural instinctive state of mind deriving from one's circumstances, mood, or relationships with others: 

• instinctive or intuitive feeling as distinguished from reasoning or knowledge:

IV. Constructing, Creating Knowledge and a Knowing

I construct the following structure: 

"conforming to principles provides a space for instinctive feelings as distinguished from reasoning or knowledge.”

I take the words further from this structure, if need be, and create simpler structures through selection and substitution, until a felt-experience is naturally and easily evoked. 

Finally, I FIT my felt-experience to the final structure. This ‘fitting' is key if I don’t want my sense-making to be mumbo-jumbo.

"I stood in line at the coffee exchange, and when i reached the end of the line the conformity of choices allowed me to make a decision instinctly. I started out thinking I’d have a latte but had a dark roast instead."

“It’s like a simple word-game,” Julia said. “Yes, indeed,” Sanjiv replied.

Sanjiv

Date: 2/23/2022 4:03:25
Subject: tips for creating and constructing structures
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

How are you? I hope you are well. I would like you to know that I don’t experience the fishbowl as stressful. I experience it as a space where I can be with myself in solitude, away from all the uncertainty that engulfs me. I experience it as the only space where I have control over my thoughts and the direction I wish to take my learning, unshackled from anything anyone else would like. I hope it is the same for you, because I don’t distinguish myself from you in this regard.

I am thinking of working on two Abstracts for the EDULEARN22 conference, and will forward you the latest call for papers from them. The Abstracts will be generated from our postings thus far in the fishbowl. The topic on Assessment of Learning (please see letter) will definitely be one of them. Be sure to address the letter, particularly if you wish to co-author the abstract. You don’t have to do anything outside what you are doing: vocabulary, google searches and felt-experiences.

Some tips when creating things out of thin air, and constructing knowledge and knowing, largely from your imagination:

Start with one word.

Look up its meaning from the Dictionary.

Write out the definition (sentence structure) from the dictionary.

Take the definition further by looking up the meaning of the key words in the above sentence structure.

Substitute the words in the original sentence and let the structure and meaning of the sentence evolve.

Keep repeating this process and save all the sentences that keep changing, until you reduce it down to its simplest form that you are comfortable with.

The felt-experience and reflection on this last sentence will come to you naturally without any difficulty because it is a simple structure of words.

The above felt-experience and reflection does not have to be profound. In fact it is most profound when you touch on the mundane and banal, because that alone resonates with your viewers and their learning in turn can begin.

The more you do the above: deconstruction and reflexivity, that is, the better you get at creating original knowledge content and a knowing from your experience.

After this process of sorting, sifting and selecting words, and the simpler is the sentence that you arrive at, the greater is its resonance with your viewers.

You become a machine that generates words. 

Words are ideas.

Words are symbols.

Words are metaphors.

Words are images.

Sanjiv

ps: please don’t have irrational fears regarding the grading in the course. So long as you do the vocabulary, you will get a B. Everything more than that, raises your grade. The straight-A is where the competition plays out, and my work lies in distinguishing them.

Date: 2/22/2022 3:25:34
Subject: Exercise on Assessment
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

How are you? I hope you are well.

I. Exercise on Assessment

I am Engaging with the question of Assessing our work in the fishbowl, in the same manner as you are Engaging with your Learning in MGT345 and MGT448.

Your Grade is an ASSESSMENT of your LEARNING. We are looking to ENGAGE with the meaning of these words and our EXPERIENCE of them in a digital environment aka the fishbowl.

Assessment is defined in the dictionary as the EVALUATION or ESTIMATION of the NATURE, QUALITY or ABILITY of someone (the Self) or something (our postings in the fishbowl). 

An assessment of KNOWLEDGE and KNOWING is the process of using EVIDENCE to UNDERSTAND and IMPROVE learning in the fishbowl. 

Most important, assessment is an IDENTIFICATION of SYMPTOMS that provides information about gaps in learning and can be used to TAILOR EFFORTS for improvement.

Let me say it in other words. 

Our self-assessment is a structured process (vocabulary, google searches, felt-experiences and exercises) which, 

we post to effectively MEASURE, 

whether or not, 

we are achieving key learning outcomes in the fishbowl, and 

to use the findings of this measurement, 

to make EFFECTIVE INTERVENTIONS for improving learning in the fishbowl.

In a nutshell, we are using four assessment methods: 

Diagnostic (identification of problem), 

Formative (development of knowledge), 

Interim (intervention), and 

Final assessment (use of a benchmark).

The Final assessment contrasts with Formative assessment which summarizes one's development at a particular time. 

The goal of our Final assessment is to evaluate our learning at the end of the semester by comparing it against a standard or benchmark. 

The Final assessment usually involves a comparison and contrast that indicates our level of performance. 

Final assessments are weighted more than formative assessments.

II. Setting the Stage

We use theatre as our metaphor in a digital environment.

Social structures like teacher/student and actor/audience are erased.

We are producing a script through performance writing.

Interplay of words through cooperation and collaboration to create original work.

We enter the unknown through words.

We are looking at each other, looking at each other.

Looking at you looking at me looking at you.

We are using the following methodologies:

Reflexivity

Participant Observation

Symbolic Interactionism

Social Constructivism

Discourse Analysis

Post-structuralism

Our purpose is to experience business by creating added-value in our Society and Culture aka the fishbowl.

Our process is straightforward:

Vocabulary

Google searches

Felt-experiences

Exercises, like Assessment above

Our practice:

Constructing structures of words

Reading each others structures for added-value.

III. Finally

We are a SOCIAL and a SYSTEM, with a DESIGN and a STRUCTURE.

Our goal is for the assignment on Assessment and on Taking-Making Notes to be peer reviewed by the accredited international conference EDULEARN22.

We will be submitting two abstracts by the due date.

Sanjiv

Subject: the second round after theory

Hi Everyone,

In the second round, think of Growth, Discipline and Integrity in terms of the Self. You may apply these three words to thoughts on your (the Self's) pandemic experience, the sports you play, the school work you do, the vocabulary you post, and so on.

Consider these three words in terms of the self-in-formation. When you describe the STRUGGLE of the Self-in-formation, you are projecting images of your Self. Your examples and descriptions are essential for the formation of society and the culture of the group.

The self-in-formation seeks to describe ESSENTIAL QUALITIES that CONSTITUTE a person's uniqueness or essential being. There have been various approaches to defining these qualities. 

The self can be considered that being which is the source of CONSCIOUSNESS, the agent responsible for an individual's thoughts and actions, or the SUBSTANTIAL NATURE of a person which ENDURES and UNIFIES consciousness over time.

Consciousness is key. The self is an individual person as the OBJECT of its own reflective consciousness.

Sanjiv

Subject: self-empowerment
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

How are you? I hope you are well.

Please see XXXX posting below. Time, Labor and Thought have been put into the Design of 3 concepts: Growth, Discipline and Integrity.

Aside: Even though I have looked up the meaning of the following words (labor, thought, design, concept and time) a thousand times, I will do so again and again, to have what we call, 'an open mind’ to further my understanding. In other words, whenever the Titanic is sinking, grab the dictionary!

However, the three well considered concepts below don't make the A category because the text is not EMPOWERED. 

From wikipedia:

Empowerment is the degree of autonomy and self-determination in people and in communities. This enables them to represent their interests in a responsible and self-determined way, acting on their own authority. It is the process of becoming stronger and more confident, especially in controlling one's life and claiming one's rights. Empowerment as action refers both to the process of self-empowerment and to professional support of people, which enables them to overcome their sense of powerlessness and lack of influence, and to recognize and use their resources.

So How do you empower your text? The question: How so?

In the 1980s, getting in touch with your feelings was a predominant lesson, particularly for men. Today, it is getting in touch with your images. Getting in touch with your images is big if you want to empower your text. For, analytical text is being done by computers, algorithms, robots and artificial intelligence.

Thought-images are like clouds that FLEET through our MINDSCAPE. They are EPHEMERAL and ETHEREAL in nature and they are unique to you. No one can originate them, except yourself.

It requires being in touch with your images.

How so?

You have to CAPTURE the fleeting thought-image. It requires going back into a past INCIDENT and let it EVOKE your images of the concept/word. DESCRIBE the image and RELATE the EVENT that is personal to you.

In the second round, pose the question How so? for each phrase that you wrote in the first round. The phrases where you can’t answer How so, delete them. They don’t empower your text.

Give it a shot. Don’t be fearful. The image for discipline that comes to my mind is the one I sent in my previous email. I think of ISIS and Afghanistan and it empowers my text when describing discipline, because I can write about the enormity of the threat that is being faced.

Please remember there is no right nor wrong. You are sharing your images and your imagination. This sharing is big in the digital environment. 

Sanjiv

XXXX » Sat Feb 19, 2022 1:07 pm

Growth: the process in people, animals or plants of growing physically, mentally or emotionally. The process of increasing in physical size. Some synonyms for growth are advancement, expansion, gain, increase, and improvement. People are constantly growing throughout their life both physically and mentally, and it is extremely important. Personal growth can mean personal development, self-help, self-growth and improvement. Successful personal growth is not only about value to your own life, but value to those around you and the society. For example, when you are in school and start a new course, you may not be educated on any of the information. But as the semester goes along, we grow and learn to master the topics. 

Discipline: the practice of training people to obey rules and orders and punishing them if they do not; the controlled behavior or situation that is the result of this training. Some synonyms are control, development, practice, regulation, and restraint. Discipline is important in every aspect of life in order to be successful and free, and it allows one to have power and control in life. It creates habits, habits make routines, and routines become who you are daily. Good discipline is important within school because it causes you to become a good student and a lifelong learner. 

Integrity: the quality of being honest and having strong moral principles. Some synonyms are honesty, purity, sincerity and virtue. to have integrity means that a person is self-aware, accountable, responsible, and truthful and that their actions are internally consistent. In the workforce, integrity is the foundation on which coworkers build relationships and trust, and it is one of the fundamental values that employers seek in the employees that they hire. 

Growth, Discipline, and Integrity all go hand in hand in becoming a good person. You learn to be disciplined as a child, and as you grow, you learn integrity. In order to be successful in school, work or life in general, it is important to master and keep these three concepts in mind at all times.

XXXX

From the dictionary...

dis·ci·pline| ˈdisəplən | 

noun

1 the practice of training people to obey rules or a code of behavior, using punishment to correct disobedience: a lack of proper parental and school discipline.

 

• the controlled behavior resulting from discipline: he was able to maintain discipline among his men.

 

• activity or experience that provides mental or physical training: the tariqa offered spiritual discipline | Kung fu is a discipline open to old and young.

 

• a system of rules of conduct: he doesn't have to submit to normal disciplines.

 

2 a branch of knowledge, typically one studied in higher education: sociology is a fairly new discipline. 

verb [with object] 

train (someone) to obey rules or a code of behavior, using punishment to correct disobedience: many parents have been afraid to discipline their children.

 

• punish or rebuke (someone) formally for an offense: a member of the staff was to be disciplined by management.

From Thesaurus

discipline

noun 

1 discipline in the camp was strict: control, regulation, direction, order, authority, rule, strictness, a firm hand; routine, regimen; training, teaching, instruction, drill, drilling, exercise; use of punishment.

2 it may take courage and discipline to do this, but it is worth the effort: self-control, self-discipline, self-government, control, controlled behavior, self-restraint; good behavior, orderliness, obedience.

3 sociology is a fairly new discipline: field (of study), branch of knowledge, course of study, subject, area; specialist subject, speciality, specialty.

verb 

1 these families have different ways of disciplining their children | you must discipline yourself into adopting regular working methods: train, drill, teach, school, coach, educate, regiment, indoctrinate; lay down the law to someone, bring into line.

2 she had learned to discipline her emotions: control, bring/keep under control, restrain, regulate, govern, keep in check, check, curb, keep a tight rein on, rein in, bridle, tame. ANTONYMS give free rein to 

3 a member of staff was to be disciplined by the management: punish, penalize, take disciplinary action against, bring to book; reprimand, rebuke, reprove, chastise, castigate, upbraid, remonstrate with; informal dress down, give someone a dressing-down, rap over the knuckles, give someone a roasting, give someone a rocket, put on the mat; British informal carpet, put on the carpet; archaic chasten.

It creates habits, habits make routines, and routines become who you are daily. Good discipline is important within school because it causes you to become a good student and a lifelong learner. 

Integrity: the quality of being honest and having strong moral principles. Some synonyms are honesty, purity, sincerity and virtue. to have integrity means that a person is self-aware, accountable, responsible, and truthful and that their actions are internally consistent. In the workforce, integrity is the foundation on which coworkers build relationships and trust, and it is one of the fundamental values that employers seek in the employees that they hire. 

Growth, Discipline, and Integrity all go hand in hand in becoming a good person. You learn to be disciplined as a child, and as you grow, you learn integrity. In order to be successful in school, work or life in general, it is important to master and keep these three concepts in mind at all times.

XXXX

From the dictionary...

dis·ci·pline| ˈdisəplən | 

noun

1 the practice of training people to obey rules or a code of behavior, using punishment to correct disobedience: a lack of proper parental and school discipline.

 

• the controlled behavior resulting from discipline: he was able to maintain discipline among his men.

 

• activity or experience that provides mental or physical training: the tariqa offered spiritual discipline | Kung fu is a discipline open to old and young.

 

• a system of rules of conduct: he doesn't have to submit to normal disciplines.

 

2 a branch of knowledge, typically one studied in higher education: sociology is a fairly new discipline. 

verb [with object] 

train (someone) to obey rules or a code of behavior, using punishment to correct disobedience: many parents have been afraid to discipline their children.

 

• punish or rebuke (someone) formally for an offense: a member of the staff was to be disciplined by management.

Subject: about Deconstruction

Hi Everyone,

How are you? I hope you are keeping well.

So far in the fishbowl, you are undertaking the following:

doing vocabulary

taking and making notes from google searches

reflective thinking: raising the question How So? in your notes and, answering from your past experiences

describing specific and concrete examples from MEMORY: felt experiences

Whenever and whatever you post, you are spot on. But is it good? Yes, so long as you are SINCERE in your learning. Only you can answer that.

Please see Page Elliott’s postings below.

The best advice I can give you at this stage is don’t worry about your Grade. I will worry about it for you. You take care of your learning.

In this letter, I am introducing the theory of deconstruction. You will subsequently be applying it to any given text (SENTENCE) that you are reading or writing.

Deconstruction, first developed by the French philosopher Jacques Derrida (please google), is a qualitative METHODOLOGY that allows researchers and practitioners, like ourselves, to ANALYZE words in order to choose the most APPROPRIATE word for the EVALUATION's PURPOSE.

Deconstruction is a way of understanding how something was created, usually things like art, books, poems and other writing, like the sentences you are posting in the fishbowl. 

Deconstruction is breaking down your sentence STRUCTURE into smaller parts, i.e., into smaller words. 

Deconstruction is LOOKING at the smaller parts that you used to create the sentence.

Deconstruction is “a method of interpretation” or rather textual INTERPRETATION, i.e., interpreting words by looking up the meaning from the dictionary.

How to Deconstruct a Text, i.e. a sentence whose meaning is CONSTITUTED by a structure of words?

1. First, you are opposing prevailing wisdom. Please keep that in mind. You are questioning the common meaning of the word you are deconstructing. You are doing this by SUBSTITUTING the word in the sentence from the dictionary/thesaurus.

2. By so doing, you are exposing the cultural bias of that sentence structure; you are analyzing the sentence structure; and, you are playing with possible meanings.

	• Expose Cultural Bias. ... 

	• Analyze Sentence Structure. ... 

	• Play With Possible Meanings.

Deconstruction assumes that WORDS cannot have a fixed meaning. An example of deconstruction is reading a novel twice, 2 years apart, and seeing how it has a different meaning each time. 

Please think about ‘deconstruction’ (Derrida). We will soon start applying it to our reading and writing practice and process. 

What does it mean to deconstruct our understanding and what causes us to do so?

Deconstruction urges us to resist the general, common meaning of a text, also known as the "privileged" meaning of a text. It helps us consider whether a word, phrase, or text might have alternative explanations that are ignored by others.

Sanjiv

from the fishbowl...STYLEs of Taking and Making Notes

"Note Taking involves writing down what you hear or read without processing the Information, whereas Note Making Involves processing what you hear or read. I. Note Taking is a passive approach to studying, whereas Note Making is an active approach to studying" (bscholary.com)

social constructivism- people communicate and rely on each other to learn new information and create different group cultures. people all learn from one another and it effects the decisions they make and actions they partake in.

the social construction of reality- knowledge is built from learning from one another- this book talks about society, human relationships and communication, and habitualization.
