Subject: apperception
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

How are you? I hope you are staying safe and, while we are at it, I trust we are constructing/creating our individual and collective mental structures. That is, being cognizant (aware) of how we ‘see’ things (word-images) and, ‘looking’ at how our individuated seeing (word-images) make us ‘feel.’ Reality is indeed perceptual. And this kind of ’seeing’ is known as APPERCEPTION. Looking at one’s INDIVIDUATED seeing. Looking at yourself looking at your self. Think about it. That is the exercise. To think how to apply the concept (word) apperception to your business, enterprise or project. What would you do? What does it take?

It might make a difference of a million bucks. All it took was thought, insight, a word, an idea on the way home. “If I run away with you, can you change my life?” she asked.

When the VW Beetle first came out, 6 VW Dealers located in RI got 4 Beetles each. One for each color, R,W,Y,B. There was much fanfare when they arrived from New Mexico, and the five colors were proudly displayed by the dealers. There was a year’s waiting list, getting longer by the day.

That semester, I had made a claim in the fishbowl, that if you followed what I was saying, you could get anything you wanted. Unrelated, I had been wondering which car to purchase and, students asked to show them getting the impossible, the VW Beetle. It took 2 letters, 2 conversations and 1 visit to the dealer on Newport Avenue, and two weeks later, I got a phone message from Dan, "Sanjiv you got the Beetle and the Red sports model." Dan was invited to class and told us how he came to that decision. Here’s what he said: “You created a reality, in which I had no choice.” In the fishbowl we are creating realities that are not fake in this day of miscommunication. Our constructed and created realties have two characteristics that make them real and worthy, and leave you no choice: TRANSPARENCY and AUTHENTICITY. It is the bedrock on which your project assignments will be based. Whenever we are transparent and authentic, in my experience, you get what you want.

There is much we want to express, but it is the loss of words (human resources) that limits the possibilities among us.

November in the fishbowl is going to be hectic for we will round-off the semester in the next three weeks, before Thanksgiving or just thereafter.

And then, we will gather our resources (words) and leave with them, re-formed and re-constituted and re-structured onto the next site/sight...living in motion and experiencing growth.

It is a good idea to read your syllabus at this juncture. It will make for much easier reading because one way or the other, you can relate it to your fishbowl.

The assignment letters are being formulated and there is time for explanations and expectations and performance. All roads lead to Rome. We just have to journey to get there. Metaphors, all metaphors. We are our metaphors. 

I wanted to get the idea of apperception across.

Sanjiv

RE-, FORM, CONSTITUTE, STRUCTURE

auto ethnography:

autoethnography is a form of qualitative research in which an author uses self-reflection and writing to explore anecdotal and personal experience and connect this autobiographical story to wider cultural, political, and social meanings and understandings.

Autoethnography is an approach to research and writing that seeks to describe and systematically analyze personal experience in order to understand cultural experience. This approach challenges canonical ways of doing research and representing others and treats research as a political, socially-just and socially-conscious act. A researcher uses tenets of autobiography and ethnography to do and write autoethnography. Thus, as a method, autoethnography is both process and product.

Key words: autoethnography; relational ethics; co-constructed narratives; interactive interviews; narrative; ethnography; personal narrative; narrative ethnographies

Co-constructed narratives: stories jointly constructed by relational partners about epiphanies in their lives. This type of research focuses on the interactional sequences by which interpretations of lived experiences are constructed, coordinated, and solidified into stories.

relational ethics: a contemporary approach to ethics that situates ethical action explicitly in relationship. If ethics is about how we should live, then it is essentially about how we should live together.

interactive interviews: Interactive interviewing is an interpretive practice for getting an in-depth and intimate understanding of people's experiences with emotionally charged and sensitive topics such as childbirth, illness, loss, and eating disorders.

narrative: a spoken or written account of connected events; a story.

ethnography: the scientific description of the customs of individual peoples and cultures.

Personal narrative: is a prose narrative relating personal experience usually told in first person; its content is nontraditional. "Personal" refers to a story from one's life or experiences.

narrative ethnographies: widens the focus to examine stories as they are being performed on specific social occasions.

------------------------------------------------------------

Watershed in the fishbowl

Watershed:an area or ridge of land that separates waters flowing to different rivers, basins, or seas.

The fishbowl is an area that separates or extracts thoughts and felt experiences from our lives and into a digital platform. It has been a crazy week full of stress and deadlines, but I return to the fishbowl with a fresh mind. These metaphors in sanjiv's letter bring me back in and ground me to the course. We are following the text. We have been posting all semester into our fishbowl and reading with our groups. We are observing one another and observing ourselves. We are keeping with the text and trying not to get lost. Our group dynamics are silent. We will eventually collaborate, but for now, we are simply following along and silently supporting one another.

Date: 10/28/2020 23:49:22
Subject: Pollock's Technique represents American values
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

If you were wondering is there a text in this class as tyler ramirez confesses below, I would like you to consider another american who also inspires: Jackson Pollock. 

If painting be a metaphor you choose to describe the fishbowl, then Jackson Pollock’s technique and paintings are your fishbowl's best representation.

Please google Jackson Pollock and reflect upon his technique and compare and contrast with your own process and practices; constructions and creations.

https://www.jacksonpollock.org

To understand your frustration and difficulty with doing and going the way of the fishbowl, please watch Pollock’s creative process in the film, Pollock, starring Ed Harris.

It’s always a good idea to make sense of what one is undergoing. Put a word to the feeling, and develop it from there. The what, why, and for whom kind of questions.

The fishbowl is about the participant's creative process. Please google Abstract Expressionism.

Three people who represent the very best of american values for me are: Wes Anderson (Midnight Kingdom in 448), Stanley Fish (he’s from Providence, btw) and Jackson Pollock. Read up on these guys. Figure out what they did. It helps in making decisions and knowing the Self. You don’t have to kill yourself reading about them (unless you’re getting a Ph.D.); you are being asked to scroll and scan and select one sentence or two. It is called mindfulness. Making sense for ourselves, starting from the perception and affirmation of what and who we are as humans here and now.

Sanjiv

TECHNIQUE, VALUE

from the fishbowl...

tyler ramirez

Posts: 85

Joined: Sat Sep 05, 2020 6:17 pm

Wed Oct 28, 2020 6:50 pm

Stanley Fish, "Is There A Text in This Class?”

Stanley Fish is one of America's most stimulating literary theorists. Criticizing the modern debates of interpretation, and stimulating a new way in which we assign and interpret meaning, ultimately benefitting our reading abilities and capabilities.

This book parallels the fishbowl experience. I even asked this question myself, however it poses the process of building into the things we do and accomplishing a mastery through slowing down and changing our position and perception of how we do things entirely.

Date: 10/28/2020 16:34:42
Subject: Action Science
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

How are you? Stay focused; we do well whenever we keep our noses to the grindstone (metaphor). 

Focus on words. Create structures of mental spaces. 

The question who and what constitutes the top 33% has been raised a couple of times in the fishbowl, and I need to explain myself further.

How do I perceive those who post regularly and faithfully in their fishbowls? That is, How do I see: What they are doing? Why are they doing it? For Whom are they doing it?

For one thing, I see them as I see myself: as action scientists. Over the course of 30 years at URI, I have tilled a lot organizational soil (metaphor) within the 'action science' tradition. Action Science is an emerging discipline. Please see: https://mitpress.mit.edu/books/action-science

Through our fishbowl postings, we are building theories out of our practice that can be used to transform practice and the organizational context in which the theories are situated. We are working practitioners; working to create 'communities of inquiry' within 'communities of practice' by ‘enacting' behavioral norms that make our inquiry more reliable and inclusive.

Action scientists use the term ‘action’ to signal a commitment to transforming practice through reflective internal critique. Same as your fishbowls.

This dual commitment of 'transforming practice' and 'self-reflecting' requires us to engage with sentence structures from three different traditions: conventional social science, interpretive approaches, and critical theory. 

Building knowledge out of practice is never easy. Messy questions of values and goals, and emotionally charged issues, all of them subject to competing interpretations.

Still there’s no avoiding complexity. Your fishbowl postings and their infinitely complex contexts in which they arise, are not only relevant to practice, but the very essence of it. Please see the posting by Ellen Swanson below.

This email is like a Preface to your Assignments for the rest of the semester, and for the conference deadline of Nov.19.

If you are feeling overwhelmed and intimidated, don’t be. The doing of the assignments is easy and you have been doing the fishbowl “way" all your life. Every thing falls into place eventually is a matter of faith, and it has thus far in our lives. It is the change in vocabulary which is the eye-opener. We ‘see’ in the digital world through words.

Sanjiv

ENACT, BEHAVIOR, NORM, COMPLEX, CONTEXT, TRANSFORM, PRACTICE, WAY, SEE, COMMUNITY, INQUIRY

from the fishbowl...

ellenswanson

Joined: Tue Sep 08, 2020 12:01 pm

Tue Oct 27, 2020 11:58 am

Figuring the process/practice for learning

Here are the sequential steps:

Select a sentence: A labyrinth, an encyclopedia, an emporium, a theatre, the fishbowl is somewhere where fact and imagination simply have to fuse.

Create a word pool: labyrinth, maze, encyclopedia, book, dictionary, theatre, play, movie, script, fishbowl, fish, learning, fact, opinion, imagination, fuse, mix

Re-structure the sentence: Many things are filled with fact and imagination it is marrying the two that is the struggle.

Do a felt-experience: A felt experience I have with the sentence is when looking at the word labyrinth I think of a book I read in high school. My favorite book about kids trying to escape a maze. It brings me happiness.

Reduce to one word-image: maze

Subject: what matters is how you interpret it
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

It is not what someone (Sanjiv’ letters) said or wrote, but how you interpreted it.

It is only when you become "literary critics" in your fishbowls, and your passing of judgment takes precedence over the reading experience that opinions begin to diverge. Diversity that is observed at subterranean levels is beautiful and vivid. Your act of interpretation and its difference is what will be remembered, not what you read nor who said it. Please google Literary Criticism.

Our fishbowl has become an “interpretive community.” Please google, Stanley Fish, "Is There A Text in This Class?”

"Our community is unified around adherence to a common set of rules which enable meaning transformations and mediations."

“Interpretive communities are made up of those who share interpretive strategies not for reading but for writing texts, for constituting their properties.” (Fish)

Our assignments are based upon social reflexivity (please see: https://science.jrank.org/pages/11000/Reflexivity-Reflexivity-in-Sociology.html)

I am working on your Assignments. Every letter leading up to them is grist to our mill (metaphor).

I hope you return again and again...stronger every time.

Sanjiv

INTERPRETATION, JUDGMENT, PRECEDENCE, SUBTERRANEAN, COMMUNITY, ADHERENCE, RULES, TRANSFORMATION, MEDIATION, MEANING

from the fishbowl...

It is incredible how our definitions, research, and responses have created such a valuable community. We are simply returning to the types of actions we learned at a very young age: looking up words, using Google, and reflecting. This time, however, we are investigating complex information. We have a greater handle on our emotions and our goals. The transparency and authenticity that Sanjiv spoke of in this letter are what has driven our relationships in the fishbowl. We must value and respect them. This past weekend, I traveled to Connecticut to coach two baseball games for the fall team that I am coaching. Although I was happy to have won both games, I was more impressed with the execution of basic fundamentals. The players were able to cleanly transfer the skills they learned at a young age to a competitive environment on the field. It reminds me of the fishbowl and the same process I spoke of a few sentences back. The player's efforts and our work in the fishbowl, as Sanjiv noted, is us making context and praxis.

As business leaders, we will connect our education at URI to the work we are responsible for. Whether it be accounting, marketing, or management, the work we have completed in past years will allow us to excel and succeed in the business world. Bridging that gap is done through repetition and practice. That is the end goal for the praxis and context we hope to create. I am eager for the coming months and years because it will be an opportunity for me to display what I have learned and perfected. I hope to look back years from now and be able to share how I have grown and how URI allowed me to build the foundation for my career. Though the future may be uncertain, we have to be confident knowing we have a solid education and the experience to outshine anyone.

Date: 10/25/2020 14:52:55
Subject: Assignments: the basic How of it
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

How are you? I hope you are well and focused upon developing strength of mind.

By now, you have understood the NATURE of CHANGE in your assignments. 

What does that mean?

We are PHENOMENOLOGISTS. Knowledge workers in a digital environment. This "perceptual shift" happened to me three decades ago. The Scandinavians and French were ahead of the game, in my opinion, but only because I was hanging out with them professionally. Since 1985 to be precise, and what a mind-blowing journey it has been.

So I search various dictionaries for the meaning of the Nature of Change; indeed the nature of anything. And I CONTEMPLATE the word, and I watch the trajectory of my search and thoughts, as I develop an understanding of this phenomenon. 

At this point, I am henceforth RESPONSIBLE and ACCOUNTABLE to my group for the SELECTION that I make from the following words that I CULLED out...

undergo transformation

change in shape

become transformed

change in form

change in appearance

change appearance

change

alter

modify

convert

metamorphose

shapeshift

transfigure

transmute

mutate

make over

undergo alteration

undergo change

go through transformation

experience transformation

suffer transformation

go through change

experience change

suffer change

go through alteration

experience alteration

suffer alteration

go through modification

experience modification

undergo modification

be altered

be converted

be changed

be modified

be transformed

change shape

change form

morph

The differences between us in the fishbowl are the difference in the selection of words that we made. Each word is a symbol and symbolizes an image. Our differences then are in the images that we hold. This creates a perceptual space and a visual culture which we call the fishbowl.

You are learning to get in touch with your images. My generation of men had to learn to be in touch and express our feelings because we were causing immense difficulties for social dynamics. As I see it, now is the turn for us to be in touch with our Images. We have to individually make the word-image connection and share our symbols in a visual culture. Our diversity, from a business point of view, lies in the differences in mental structures and our ability to connect them.

Once you get the hang of this, things like systems, domains, discourses, vision, perception, dimensions, all fall into place. It is generally agreed by thinkers, leaders, and researchers across the world, that we are facing a crisis in perception. We are at the beginning of a new beginning.

More assignment details to follow. I know what has to be done, it is just that I am contemplating on how to say it, so that the impact of words are the greatest. We’ve only got words among us, please keep that in mind. And, we are developing skills and understandings that we believe will prove useful in the future; useful in raising the right questions. The answers are blowing in the wind (metaphor/image) and require little work!

Sanjiv

from the fishbowl...

Sat Oct 24, 2020 11:59 pm

"For instance, a question like: what does Courage have to do with Society and Culture? To answer such a question requires the individual searching for knowledge, aka 'research.'"

COURAGE: the ability to do something that frightens one.

SOCIETY: the community of people living in a particular country or region and having shared customs, laws, and organizations.

CULTURE: the arts and other manifestations of human intellectual achievement regarded collectively.

What does the ability to do something that frightens someone have to do with community and manifestations of human intellectual achievement?

I don't pretend to know what the scholarly answer to this question would be, but I can make my own best guess from what I've read and what I've experienced. I'd say that different societies and cultures have different ideas about courage. Some, like America, see courage as being a strong-willed, strong-minded individual who laughs in the face of fear. Some, like North Korea, see courage as being ready to die for your country (nothing more, nothing less).

When I personally reflect on what courage has to do with society and culture, I think it means having the guts to stand up for a belief that's not mainstream. Just a few days ago I was tested in this way. I attended a film festival screening where one of my short films was shown. I made this film last year, but with everything that has happened in 2020, I was afraid it's (potentially controversial) message would be totally skewed. As I sat there and watched my film with everyone else, I panicked. I thought I would be eaten alive when it was time for Q&A! I seriously thought about walking out, driving home, and never looking back...but I stayed. I had a moment of cowardice, but stuck it out because deep down I believed in the film's core message. And to my surprise, many others did as well. I'm glad I didn't succumb to the fear of my work not being "socially acceptable". I learned something that night about practicing courage.

Date: 10/23/2020 21:42:43
Subject: Assignment: Context and Praxis
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

How are you? I hope you are keeping well and in good cheer. Concepts (mental constructs) like attitude, creativity, cooperation, courage, engagement, belief, faith are essential to understand, like never before, for they are now in the charge of the individual. It is indeed, the Age of the Millennials. For instance, a question like: what does Courage have to do with Society and Culture? To answer such a question requires the individual searching for knowledge, aka “research.” 

At this point of time you have been exposed to several research methodologies and you have made some sense of them for yourselves. If you haven’t, then the expression on my face is one of quizzicalness! Please be sure to do so: one sentence each from scrolling, surfing, sorting and selecting.

You started with a dictionary, and then you forged, forked, focused and furrowed your way through and you shared your learning trajectory (being transparent and authentic). This re-search process is known as “auto ethnography” (please google). 

To survive the environment we inhabit in fishbowls, we are developing individual viewpoints (auto-ethnographies) about the meaning of Society in 345 and of Culture in 448. 

Stay tuned by critically and creatively re-reading and writing regularly in the fishbowl. You are making a CONTEXT and a PRAXIS. You’re setting the stage (metaphor).

"Praxis (from Ancient Greek: πρᾶξις, romanized: praxis) is the process by which a theory, lesson, or skill is enacted, embodied, or realized. "Praxis" may also refer to the act of engaging, applying, exercising, realizing, or practicing ideas."

 

I’m going to sign off for now, and in the next letter, I’m going to make one example of your assignments in 345 and 448 and deconstruct it open, piecemeal. One step at a time. I’ll take you by the hand, because I was once in your position and I was confronting Professor Linda Smircich in a Ph.D program at UMass. And was I scared! My generation of men didn’t know a felt-experience! And we just weren’t the touchy-feely sitting in a circle types.

I perceive Adam Beckett in 345/1 in the fishbowl as a straight A. In different circumstances, I would seek him out and thank him for his contributions and reflections toward Learning. It’s a great thing, to say the least. It is for students like Beckett that I'm motivated to give you a shot at an international research conference, generally reserved for doctoral students and faculty. Breaking structures and Action Research. More on those later.

Sanjiv

RESEARCH, PRAXIS, CONTEXT

from the fishbowl...

------------------------------------------------------------
Date: 10/22/2020 15:25:30
Subject: watershed in the fishbowl (1)
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

We’re at a watershed (metaphor) and I hope you have been holding-up (metaphor) during these treacherous (metaphor) times. I wonder if you're aware that in the present environment, the world is counting on you. Please google Harry Potter.

Please view the text in this letter as a sketch (metaphor) of what lies ahead for the rest of the semester. It is laid out in three sections: grades, assignments and conference submission. Any questions and thoughts that arise can be addressed in your fishbowls. After doing that, you may email me directly with your concerns, again in the fishbowl. I am looking at you looking at me looking at you...we are in perceptual space, please bear that in mind. What are we looking at? We’re ‘looking' at our Group Dynamics (please google).

from wiki:

"Group dynamics is a system of behaviors and psychological processes occurring within a social group (intragroup dynamics), or between social groups (intergroup dynamics). The study of group dynamics can be useful in understanding decision-making behaviour, tracking the spread of diseases in society, creating effective therapy techniques, and following the emergence and popularity of new ideas and technologies.[1] Group dynamics are at the core of understanding racism, sexism, and other forms of social prejudice and discrimination. These applications of the field are studied in psychology, sociology, anthropology, political science, epidemiology, education, social work, business and managerial studies, as well as communication studies."

I. Grades 

I will present the options and choices you have with regard to your grade and the assumptions on which they are based so you can make reasonable decisions going forward. That’s a popular metaphor in recent use: “going forward.”

II. Assignments

I will attempt to lay out the assignments in specific terms (greater detail as to their steps will follow in subsequent letters) and what you can expect for the rest of the semester.

III. Authorship of Abstract submitted to International Conference

I will discuss the possibility of having our joint Abstract accepted at an International Conference. What are we doing in the fishbowl and why are we doing it?

I. Grades

The lowest grade is a B. Everyone gets a minimum of a B based upon the assumption that you are reading my letters and finding evidence in the postings of participating students. This assumption, regarding your reading, makes us a fishbowl swimming in perceptual space where we are looking at each Other. It allows us to compare and contrast in the act of reading. Please google ‘critical reading.'

Your immediate fishbowl is a group of three where members are able to ‘read-into' each other. Like a family, they are privy to the trajectory of each other’s thoughts. 

Three is a good number for this purpose.

By the simple act of being present, you created and constructed a perceptual space made up of (constituted by) three interacting mental structures. 

The interaction of mental structures occurs in the head because words are symbols which an individual interprets according to past experience. We do it instantaneously.

Every word evokes or flashes an image in our heads. Please verify for yourselves. 

You have to do the verifying yourself. In that regard here’s a metaphor to consider: When I go to the gym after paying a hefty membership, I have to do the crunches myself and not the trainer who is charging by the hour.

The letter grades B+/A- and A are clearly visible in the fishbowl. Very simply, you’re generating text out of thin air. Building castles, structures, spirals and domes. Simulated reality and Speculative Realism (please google). 

It boils down to quantity and quality of your postings. 

Most of it is copying the gurus (not each other) and becoming knowledgeable. That’s a B+. 

Infusing felt-experiences makes you an Expert and puts you in the A- category. 

The more you do it, the better your quality and you find yourself in the A category.

No one can best the combination of Knowledge plus Expertise. Please bear that in mind.

What are the cut-off points? How many postings make an A? 

The numbers are divided into 33% each. 

In this way, at any point in the semester, you can perceive your grade in the fishbowl.

You are the harbinger of your own destiny.

II. Assignments

Assignments for 345 and for 448 is next. Stay tuned before the night is out...

At this point you have understood and have an idea of the research methodologies being used. If you don’t please do the needful:

One sentence selected and experienced for each of the following:

participant-observation, symbolic interactionism, social constructivism, and social reflexivity.

Regarding assignments, I see ourselves as 'being behind a bit but itching to move forward.’

Riding slow waiting for the moon to show...(Bruce Coburn). Staying well and not straying too far afield. (All metaphors).

Enjoy the day. I think of you all the time.

Google Search:

Paulo Freire - Paulo was a Brazilian philosopher most known for critical pedagogy, or problem-posing education. This idea uses the perspective that the modern teacher holds themselves in a position of omnipotence in relation to the students, and the students know nothing. The teachers pose to be this all- knowing being who is above the students, without acknowledging that they themselves could also learn more and could learn from anyone including the students.

Hi Everyone,

Any questions and thoughts that arise can be addressed in your fishbowls. After doing that, you may email me directly with your concerns, again in the fishbowl. I am looking at you looking at me looking at you...we are in perceptual space, please bear that in mind. What are we looking at? We’re ‘looking' at our Group Dynamics (please google).

from wiki:

"Group dynamics is a system of behaviors and psychological processes occurring within a social group (intragroup dynamics), or between social groups (intergroup dynamics). The study of group dynamics can be useful in understanding decision-making behaviour, tracking the spread of diseases in society, creating effective therapy techniques, and following the emergence and popularity of new ideas and technologies.[1] Group dynamics are at the core of understanding racism, sexism, and other forms of social prejudice and discrimination. These applications of the field are studied in psychology, sociology, anthropology, political science, epidemiology, education, social work, business and managerial studies, as well as communication studies."

Subject: processes of self-organization is a key competence
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

What does connectivity mean in the age of "networked individualism”?

For one thing, it means thinking in new ways. 

Which means having flexible mental structures.

What does that mean?

In our fishbowls, we are developing new ways of thinking about organizing (words) and organizations (student/teacher, etc.).

We’re doing this by changing the image of ourselves and what we do. How so? You're not doing anything, you might respond!

For instance, every time you post vocabulary (the action of selecting the meaning of a word), you are re-imaging yourself.

Please verify this from your postings.

15 concepts for consideration by Businesses operating in a Digital Society: 

connectivity

networked individualism

flexibility

mental structure

develop thinking

organizing

organization

competence

reimagine

select meaning

evolve

facilitate

encourage

change

environment

 

We have been developing a new (management) practice and process (theory).

Which is what?

We are self-organizing, evolving, twisting and turning...perhaps changing at the speed of light! In our fishbowls we left the environment of organized organizations and created instead an environment where the ability to understand, facilitate, and encourage 'processes of self-organization' is a key competence. 

Please see Dana DiCristofaro’s posting below as an excellent example of “networked individualism” and process of self-organization.

Sanjiv

Meaning: connected at multiple points or levels

Meaning: To join or fasten together

Meaning: To increase the size, volume, quantity, or scope of; enlarge

Substitution within context: We are knowledge workers increasing the scope to the extent of being interconnected.

Meaning: Space, amount, or the degree to which a thing extends; size; length; breadth

Substitution within context: We are knowledge workers expanding the space of being interconnected.

INTERFACE: A point where two systems, subjects or organizations meet and interact.

LABYRINTH: A complicated irregular network of passages or paths.

MULTIPLE: Having or involving several parts, elements or members.

REPRESENTATION: The action of speaking or acting on behalf of someone.

CONNECTION: A relationship in which a person, thing or idea is linked or associated with something else

KNOWLEDGE: Facts, information and skills acquired by a person through experience.

KNOWING: Showing or suggesting that one has knowledge or awareness that is secret.

JUXTAPOSITION: The fact of two things being seen or placed close together with contrasting effect.

INFLECTION: A change in the form of a word to express a grammatical function.

HIATUS: A pause or gap in a sequence, series or process.

SERENDIPITY: The occurrence and development of events by chance in a happy or beneficial way.

“We live today with multiple representations, some we call science and some we call art, precise, abstract, vivid, and evocative, each one proposing new connections.”

And such is our reality as we interface on our screens. We are in a labyrinth.

One’s intellectual journey, one’s trajectory of thoughts, is made of things such as juxtapositions, inflections, hiatus, serendipity. 

******

Sanjiv

c: 345

from wiki...

Labyrinth

Silver coin from Knossosdisplaying the 7-course "Classical" design to represent the Labyrinth, 400 BC.

In Greek mythology, the Labyrinth was an elaborate, confusing structure designed and built by the legendary artificer Daedalus for King Minos of Crete at Knossos. Its function was to hold the Minotaur, the monster eventually killed by the hero Theseus. Daedalus had so cunningly made the Labyrinth that he could barely escape it after he built it.

Date: 10/17/2020 22:10:41
Subject: genesis of the fishbowl
------------------------------------------------------------
THE DEPTH

		OF AN EXAMINED RELATIONSHIP 

		

		IS MATCHED

		BY THE EXPANSE

		OF UNDERSTANDING AND FEELING:

Management Passion in the New Millennium

Presentation 

by matt & sanjiv, 

of matt & sanjiv, 

for matt & sanjiv.

 	 

 	Copyright, Letters To Matt, @dugal, 1999

Prologue

Midway, this way of life we’re bound upon

I woke to find myself in a dark wood,

Where the right road was wholly lost and gone.

Aye me, how hard to speak of it,

The rude and rough and stubborn forest,

The mere breath of memory stirs the old fear in the blood.

But when, at last, I stood beneath a steep hillside,

Which closed the valley’s wandering maze,

Whose dread had pierced me to the heart root deep.

Then I looked up and saw the morning rays

Mantle its shoulder from that planet bright

Which guides men’s feet aright

On all their ways.

		(from “Divina Commedia” by Dante Alighieri)

	

		 IN THE FISH-BOWL

Creating this fish-bowl is a performative act. It is a gesture for the continuation of a story... we’re writing as we go along… we do not know where it will lead, nor where it will end…but we know this for sure, it exists in our heads.

		

This is the story of two characters, matt and sanjiv, and the narrative unfolds in new england, at a small university near the ocean…where they’re swimming in a mental fish-bowl, combining Western sensibilities with Eastern ideas…in tryst with purpose, but shunning all direction, except an inner pressure to radicalize. One Viking, the other Sikh, they progress from liberating ego structures, through deeply bled wounds onto downward spirals of hatred and feelings of isolation, and then returning with renewed joy of understanding, forgiveness, and anticipation. Bringing a surging heritage (of bravery in battle) in their bloods, their forays range from existential arguments, to sudden affectionate détentes, and finally onto other arguments. Their relationship mirrors the profound changes in their lifestyles, in their conceptions of work, and of themselves. Determined to move away from conventional categories (of the division between self and other, of the representation of individuality, of established academic standards) in order to reflect a vision of themselves that transcends these boundaries in a new way. The two characters have an odd volatile nature to their wooing…their interactions end suddenly, and generally with puzzled amusement. They improvise, fabricate, and talk about dimensions and chemistry between people… at times their minds almost meet on the same page, until one makes a tiny faux pas that the other sees as shattering…they’re able to maintain this fragility by improvising from moment to moment. That is, they allow themselves to let their personalities and moods influence their performance but not alter the words or circumstances of the scene they enact in their minds…they really have very different ways of thinking, but are able to pass the ball back and forth easily, making for spontaneous fun.

So how do they do this in the fish-bowl? Like their characters, matt and sanjiv can’t agree. “The more I do it,” sanjiv said, “ the more I realize the character is me.” For matt, “it’s a matter of stripping down my defense mechanisms to being that vulnerable again.” Sanjiv countered: “I think for me it’s more building on top of me. I think.”

This interaction ended suddenly, as many interactions between matt and sanjiv, with puzzled bemusement.

Creating a Concept: the Fish-bowl

Instead of the idea of a relationship (like, teacher/student), attached to a real place (like, College of Business at URI), we created the idea of a place, attached to real people, namely, matt-and-sanjiv-in-a-fish-bowl. In this imaginary place, the Fish-bowl, with extraordinary patience and power, through words, we agreed to project awareness and unity of self as the principle theme. 

The Fish-bowl is a meeting place of the mind; it is a metaphysical place. There is no hiding here for matt-sanjiv because they’re simultaneously, observers and observed. 	

It cannot be assumed that the Fish-bowl is a determined, ordered system intelligible to the outsider who can discover the natural laws that govern matt-sanjiv, or that the role of reason is the power guiding matt-sanjiv.

Rationally and empirically, the Fish-bowl has no significance. It can only be seen in terms of the impact that the matt-sanjiv experience will make on its existence.

			

		2.20.99

My Dear Siddharatha,

During our period of estrangement, our inward journey was around doubts as to “who I am” and, “what I stand for,” i.e. who is the authentic self? Am I this, or, am I that? 

Through thought alone, one transcends a situation (of this/that), and thus we transcended our 

situation, comprising of hurt and feelings of insult, by conceiving the fish-bowl. However, to act upon thought, (beginning with the memo allocating matt’s assistantship to sanjiv), is a contingent act… to survive, to live, to be represented. Our contingent act was a gesture demarcating matt-sanjiv representation. Gesture demarcates, and so we conceive of ourselves…

				

The fish-bowl is

 			a contingent act 

a gesture 

 			to exist. 

The betrayal 

of ideas 

is a death 

to being. 

To open one’s mind 

and one’s mental routine 

to the world

is to open one’s heart.

From, 

your very dear friend, Hermann Hesse.

Our Intent: to Play a Unique Role

Our intent is to play a unique role in education: to gain intellect not through verbal discourse per se but through presentation of thought and action; not through involvement with people in an outside world but in a Way Within or an Inward Way that presents world as inner landscape, and so carry out in practice our theme of awareness and unity of self.

Fear of Expressing Feelings

We do not always express Feelings because they’re often Confused, and even Frightening. However, to deny Feelings is to make false, restricted work. To be inauthentic and fake.

In the fish bowl we’re learning to touch Feelings. We touch through expression, i.e. expressing conceptions and perceptions of things, including each other. Particularly, differences like viking/sikh, west/east, physical/ mental, student/teacher,love/hate, and other such dimensions. 

We touch Feelings under public gaze. We have a need to go public with every thing that we say or do.

We’re developing a need to write.

Management Principle 1: Conceiving Ambiguity, Creating Possibility

Ambiguous space is nonhierarchical, horizontal. Its nodes intersect in random, unregulated networks in which any node can interconnect with any other node. We create a new form of rhizomatic knowledge by mixing metaphors. Rhizome is a complex metaphor that contrasts with rooted, 

traditional metaphors, such as, teacher/student. In the fish-bowl, matt-and-sanjiv celebrate their nomadic and schizophrenic qualities. 

We’re motivated to do this because to conceive of ambiguity is to create possibility, and the stronger the ambiguity, the greater is our creativity, and the more powerful our felt-experience.

In the fish-bowl, we’ve created an ambiguious relationship between ourselves: 

we’ve fulfilled all formal requirements (papers, etc.), yet we’re inconclusive about them (grades, etc.); 

we’re not involved in each others research, yet our interaction is research; 

matt is paid fifteen hours/week to assist sanjiv, yet it is sanjiv who assists matt.

The ambiguity in our relationship creates possibility because it allows us to be anything we want. This freedom makes us examine each other in ways we hadn’t been able to see before.

				

Management Principle 2: Creating Myth

The “fish-bowl” is an example of creating a myth. Myth is created inter-subjectively between matt and sanjiv.

“Myth (of matt-sanjiv-in-a-fish-bowl) is a system of communication, it is a message. It is a mode of signification, a form. We assign to this form historical limits, conditions of use, and reintroduce community into it: we must nevertheless first describe it as a form.” (roland barthes)

We use our imagination to describe our form of myth.

The matt-sanjiv form is diasporic ambiguity.

The college of business at URI is percieving and experiencing it.

	Management Principle 3: Create Myth/Intersubjectivity/Intertextuality

Intersubjectivity helps matt-sanjiv to see that most human experience and action goes on between the self and others.

Myth creates Inter-subjectivity; and Inter-subjectivity creates Myth. However, in the fish-bowl the notion of Intertextuality replaces that of Intersubjectivity. “Every text is constructed as a mosaic of other texts, every text is an absorbtion and transformation of other texts” (julia kristeva). Through their intersubjectivity and intertextuality, around the texts of T.E. Lawrence (Lawrence of Arabia), Rainer Rilke (German poet), and Thomas Becket (Archbishop of Canterbury), among others, matt-sanjiv create the myth of the fish-bowl. 

					2.19.99

Dear Matt,

Thank you for expressing feelings so eloquently through the mouth of Mr. Kappus. 

You are Mr. Kappus. 

When reading our exchange of letters, it is evident that one’s authentic self is indeed problematic in a situation where one can be anything one wants. 

		 			We can be friends forever.

Between ourselves: Mr. Kappus, T.E Lawrence, the English, Rilke, Sartre, Hesse, the German, Eriksen, Viking, Siddharatha, Buddha, the Indian, Eakins, the American, Dugal, Sikh, Baudelaire, the French, the West and the East, we’re creating an inter-textuality, an inter-subjectivity, and a shared memory. Indeed, we’re creating our context. We’re laying the foundation. 

Through this labyrinthe lies the inward journey of the subjective self. 

I find your words,“ Even when overcome by feelings of hate, I still knew that our relationship was a source of great knowledge and understanding” to be most telling of our universal condition, because the central problem is not an abstract one, but one of contingency: what we lack is certainty, confidence, sense of purpose to break paradoxical situations like feelings of hate/ and feelings of great understanding. That is, the more I hate, the more I understand, and the more I understand, the more I hate. 

			

If we had more access to our own past, to memory, to inter-textuality and inter-subjectivity, our sense of purpose would be immensely augmented. Hesse’s Steppenwolf expressed this sense of meaning due to re-possession of the past: 

“For moments together my heart stood still between delight and sorrow to find how rich was the gallery of my life, and how thronged the soul of the wretched steppenwolf with high eternal stars and constellations… the kernel of this life of mine was noble. It came of high descent and turned, not on trifles, but on the stars…”(Steppenwolf, Hesse).

From your friend, Sanjiv

Myth/Intersubjectivity/Intertextuality are Inter-connected. 

Inter-connectedness is the understanding that relations, connecting and opposing, exist. 

			Even lies are part of the truth.	

To be Inter-connected is To-Be-Aware-of-Other-Realities, 

i.e. to be aware of opposing myths, metaphors, dimensions, 

and their on-going interactive inter-subjectivities.

“matt-sanjiv-in-the-fish-bowl” are aware of the what, why, whom, and wherefrom concerning their myth.

					2.21.99

Dear Lief Erikson theViking,

One’s position within a relationship, like,Viking-Sikh, has to do with intersubjective interpretation, in other words, position is determined by our past (shared memory), our present (interpretation), and, our future (imagination). 

The activities representing the past, present, and future, are overlapping in the new millennium to the extent of becoming indistinguishable. We’re experiencing confusion, loss of control, etc. In such a situation, how do I determine my sense of self? 

To do so, I reveal a structure, or deconstruct one, or imaginatively construct one…here’s mine: “I was sent to these Arabs as a stranger, unable to think their thoughts or subscribe their beliefs, but charged by duty to lead them forward and to develop to the highest any movement of theirs profitable to England in her war. If I could not assume their character, I could atleast conceal my own, and pass among them without evident friction, neither a discord nor a critic but an unnoticed influence. Since I was their fellow I will not be their apologist or advocate. Today in my old garments, I could play the bystander, obedient to the sensibilities of our theatre…but it is more honest to record that these ideas and actions then passed naturally. What now looks wanton or sadic seemed in the field inevitable or just unimportant routine.” (T.E. Lawrence, Seven Pillars of Wisdom, 1926)

What is our intersubjective interpretation of the above text with regard to us, as Viking-Sikh? Here is a random list of specifics for us to address in the fish-bowl:

1. locate the fear

2. build history

3. zoom in and out

4. raise the stakes

5. get specific

6. explore the underside

Yours truly,

				

Sardar Bahadur Singh the Sikh

Management Principle 4: Experiencing Learning

In the fish-bowl the problem of Being takes precedence over that of Knowing (when acquiring a Ph.D. or anything else). 

“Being cannot be made a subject of objective enquiry; it is revealed to the individual by reflecting on his own unique concrete existence in time and space. Existence is basic: it is the fact of the individual’s presence and participation in a changing and potentially dangerous world. Each self-aware individual understands his own existence in terms of his experience of himself and of his situation. The self of which he is aware is a thinking being which has beliefs, hopes, fears, desires, the need to find a purpose, and a will that can determine his actions.” (sartre)

	Real and Unreal:

We are free to choose between authentic and fake as a form of existence. Freedom distinguishes between “authentic” and “inauthentic” forms of existence. 

In the fish-bowl we distinguish between authentic/fake on the basis of our endeavor to transcend a particular dimension or form. 

This endeavor is the matt-sanjiv form of Authenticity.

We are free to choose our reality.

	

Management Principle 5: Creating Reality as Representational Space

I can represent something (teacher), if you represent the other (student).

You can only represent something (youth), if I represent the other (mid-life).

in this dimension we are bound

Whenever we articulate other dimensions, other myths, other inter-subjectivites, other realities, other representational spaces, we ipso facto create a temporal and spatial disjunction. 

When we articulate the meaning of a new dimension, we experience temporal and spatial disjunction as representational space. 

	Matt & Sanjiv occupy several dimensions, but their spirits are free.

					Viking and Sikh

	

	Reality of Humility/Arrogance

Matt and Sanjiv are inter-connected on the following dimension:

It is one of several operating realities between us. 

The existence of humility in matt’s being is dependent upon the existence of arrogance in sanjiv’s being; 

and the existence of humility in sanjiv’s being is dependent upon the existence of arrogance in matt’s being.

 We’re hooked.

 		We can be anything we want. It’s all in our heads.

	

Our Method: the Interplay between Verbalized-Thought and Felt-Experience

In the fish-bowl, the interplay between our two distinct identities brought complexity and depth to our respective worlds. We interpreted text (and each-other), as we saw (perceived) and felt (experienced) it. Even as we respect another’s text, we brought our subjectivity to bear upon it. We infused the text with our individual being; not the other way round. The text did not infuse us. 

In other words, we used words as expressions of sensed-thought (felt-experience) rather than as verbalized-thought in promoting the idea of unity above the inner divisions between us. Our interpreted text reveals us and reflects on us.

Example of Verbalized-thought:

“That evening, I found that I had to untangle two different reactions, writing a description of the conversation and, carefully separated, an expression of my feelings as a member of another culture. Each person is calibrated by experience, almost like a measuring instrument for difference, so discomfort is informative and offers a starting point for new understanding. Indeed, what I had seen and heard would not have pushed me to reflection and generalization were it not for the urgency produced by the sense of difference.”

(Mary Catherine Bateson, Peripheral Visions, page 17)

Example of Felt-experience:

In the fish-bowl we found

we had to untangle two processes:

description of the script (between us), 

and carefully separated, 

expression of (our) feelings.

WORDS DESCRIBE, STEP BACK, FEELINGS EXPRESS

We experience difference through the expression of feelings.

Discomfort from difference is Information;

Information is a starting point for new Understanding.

		

EXPERIENCE DIFFERENCE THRU EXPRESSION

	(My) experence, 

Makes (me)

different (from you).

difference (from you)

Makes (me) 

experience (you).

 DIFFERENCE CREATES SOMETHING NEW

The urgency 

produced by our sense of difference

Forces us to 

Reflect and Transcend the situation.

From the above method, what we learned about ourselves and for the practice of management were the following:

Construct a text/written script

express feelings

expressing feelings makes for difference 

sense of difference produces urgency

 			urgency requires us to reflect, and to transcend

			the written text…

Principle activity: create a sense of difference to achieve unity above inner divisions.

It’ All In Our Heads

						Thank you

								Bye…for 

now.

THE DEPTH

		OF AN EXAMINED RELATIONSHIP 

		

		IS MATCHED

		BY THE EXPANSE

		OF UNDERSTANDING AND FEELING:

Management Passion in the New Millennium

Presentation 

by matt & sanjiv, 

of matt & sanjiv, 

for matt & sanjiv.

 	 

 	Copyright, Letters To Matt, @dugal, 1999

Prologue

Midway, this way of life we’re bound upon

I woke to find myself in a dark wood,

Where the right road was wholly lost and gone.

Aye me, how hard to speak of it,

The rude and rough and stubborn forest,

The mere breath of memory stirs the old fear in the blood.

But when, at last, I stood beneath a steep hillside,

Which closed the valley’s wandering maze,

Whose dread had pierced me to the heart root deep.

Then I looked up and saw the morning rays

Mantle its shoulder from that planet bright

Which guides men’s feet aright

On all their ways.

		(from “Divina Commedia” by Dante Alighieri)

	

		 IN THE FISH-BOWL

Creating this fish-bowl is a performative act. It is a gesture for the continuation of a story... we’re writing as we go along… we do not know where it will lead, nor where it will end…but we know this for sure, it exists in our heads.

		

This is the story of two characters, matt and sanjiv, and the narrative unfolds in new england, at a small university near the ocean…where they’re swimming in a mental fish-bowl, combining Western sensibilities with Eastern ideas…in tryst with purpose, but shunning all direction, except an inner pressure to radicalize. One Viking, the other Sikh, they progress from liberating ego structures, through deeply bled wounds onto downward spirals of hatred and feelings of isolation, and then returning with renewed joy of understanding, forgiveness, and anticipation. Bringing a surging heritage (of bravery in battle) in their bloods, their forays range from existential arguments, to sudden affectionate détentes, and finally onto other arguments. Their relationship mirrors the profound changes in their lifestyles, in their conceptions of work, and of themselves. Determined to move away from conventional categories (of the division between self and other, of the representation of individuality, of established academic standards) in order to reflect a vision of themselves that transcends these boundaries in a new way. The two characters have an odd volatile nature to their wooing…their interactions end suddenly, and generally with puzzled amusement. They improvise, fabricate, and talk about dimensions and chemistry between people… at times their minds almost meet on the same page, until one makes a tiny faux pas that the other sees as shattering…they’re able to maintain this fragility by improvising from moment to moment. That is, they allow themselves to let their personalities and moods influence their performance but not alter the words or circumstances of the scene they enact in their minds…they really have very different ways of thinking, but are able to pass the ball back and forth easily, making for spontaneous fun.

So how do they do this in the fish-bowl? Like their characters, matt and sanjiv can’t agree. “The more I do it,” sanjiv said, “ the more I realize the character is me.” For matt, “it’s a matter of stripping down my defense mechanisms to being that vulnerable again.” Sanjiv countered: “I think for me it’s more building on top of me. I think.”

This interaction ended suddenly, as many interactions between matt and sanjiv, with puzzled bemusement.

Creating a Concept: the Fish-bowl

Instead of the idea of a relationship (like, teacher/student), attached to a real place (like, College of Business at URI), we created the idea of a place, attached to real people, namely, matt-and-sanjiv-in-a-fish-bowl. In this imaginary place, the Fish-bowl, with extraordinary patience and power, through words, we agreed to project awareness and unity of self as the principle theme. 

The Fish-bowl is a meeting place of the mind; it is a metaphysical place. There is no hiding here for matt-sanjiv because they’re simultaneously, observers and observed. 	

It cannot be assumed that the Fish-bowl is a determined, ordered system intelligible to the outsider who can discover the natural laws that govern matt-sanjiv, or that the role of reason is the power guiding matt-sanjiv.

Rationally and empirically, the Fish-bowl has no significance. It can only be seen in terms of the impact that the matt-sanjiv experience will make on its existence.

			

		2.20.99

My Dear Siddharatha,

During our period of estrangement, our inward journey was around doubts as to “who I am” and, “what I stand for,” i.e. who is the authentic self? Am I this, or, am I that? 

Through thought alone, one transcends a situation (of this/that), and thus we transcended our 

situation, comprising of hurt and feelings of insult, by conceiving the fish-bowl. However, to act upon thought, (beginning with the memo allocating matt’s assistantship to sanjiv), is a contingent act… to survive, to live, to be represented. Our contingent act was a gesture demarcating matt-sanjiv representation. Gesture demarcates, and so we conceive of ourselves…

				

The fish-bowl is

 			a contingent act 

a gesture 

 			to exist. 

The betrayal 

of ideas 

is a death 

to being. 

To open one’s mind 

and one’s mental routine 

to the world

is to open one’s heart.

From, 

your very dear friend, Hermann Hesse.

Our Intent: to Play a Unique Role

Our intent is to play a unique role in education: to gain intellect not through verbal discourse per se but through presentation of thought and action; not through involvement with people in an outside world but in a Way Within or an Inward Way that presents world as inner landscape, and so carry out in practice our theme of awareness and unity of self.

Fear of Expressing Feelings

We do not always express Feelings because they’re often Confused, and even Frightening. However, to deny Feelings is to make false, restricted work. To be inauthentic and fake.

In the fish bowl we’re learning to touch Feelings. We touch through expression, i.e. expressing conceptions and perceptions of things, including each other. Particularly, differences like viking/sikh, west/east, physical/ mental, student/teacher,love/hate, and other such dimensions. 

We touch Feelings under public gaze. We have a need to go public with every thing that we say or do.

We’re developing a need to write.

Management Principle 1: Conceiving Ambiguity, Creating Possibility

Ambiguous space is nonhierarchical, horizontal. Its nodes intersect in random, unregulated networks in which any node can interconnect with any other node. We create a new form of rhizomatic knowledge by mixing metaphors. Rhizome is a complex metaphor that contrasts with rooted, 

traditional metaphors, such as, teacher/student. In the fish-bowl, matt-and-sanjiv celebrate their nomadic and schizophrenic qualities. 

We’re motivated to do this because to conceive of ambiguity is to create possibility, and the stronger the ambiguity, the greater is our creativity, and the more powerful our felt-experience.

In the fish-bowl, we’ve created an ambiguious relationship between ourselves: 

we’ve fulfilled all formal requirements (papers, etc.), yet we’re inconclusive about them (grades, etc.); 

we’re not involved in each others research, yet our interaction is research; 

matt is paid fifteen hours/week to assist sanjiv, yet it is sanjiv who assists matt.

The ambiguity in our relationship creates possibility because it allows us to be anything we want. This freedom makes us examine each other in ways we hadn’t been able to see before.

				

Management Principle 2: Creating Myth

The “fish-bowl” is an example of creating a myth. Myth is created inter-subjectively between matt and sanjiv.

“Myth (of matt-sanjiv-in-a-fish-bowl) is a system of communication, it is a message. It is a mode of signification, a form. We assign to this form historical limits, conditions of use, and reintroduce community into it: we must nevertheless first describe it as a form.” (roland barthes)

We use our imagination to describe our form of myth.

The matt-sanjiv form is diasporic ambiguity.

The college of business at URI is percieving and experiencing it.

	Management Principle 3: Create Myth/Intersubjectivity/Intertextuality

Intersubjectivity helps matt-sanjiv to see that most human experience and action goes on between the self and others.

Myth creates Inter-subjectivity; and Inter-subjectivity creates Myth. However, in the fish-bowl the notion of Intertextuality replaces that of Intersubjectivity. “Every text is constructed as a mosaic of other texts, every text is an absorbtion and transformation of other texts” (julia kristeva). Through their intersubjectivity and intertextuality, around the texts of T.E. Lawrence (Lawrence of Arabia), Rainer Rilke (German poet), and Thomas Becket (Archbishop of Canterbury), among others, matt-sanjiv create the myth of the fish-bowl.

That is, the more I hate, the more I understand, and the more I understand, the more I hate. 

			

If we had more access to our own past, to memory, to inter-textuality and inter-subjectivity, our sense of purpose would be immensely augmented. Hesse’s Steppenwolf expressed this sense of meaning due to re-possession of the past: 

“For moments together my heart stood still between delight and sorrow to find how rich was the gallery of my life, and how thronged the soul of the wretched steppenwolf with high eternal stars and constellations… the kernel of this life of mine was noble. It came of high descent and turned, not on trifles, but on the stars…”(Steppenwolf, Hesse).

From your friend, Sanjiv

“matt-sanjiv-in-the-fish-bowl” are aware of the what, why, whom, and wherefrom concerning their myth.

Hi Everyone,

How are you? I hope you are doing well and holding up. Through adversity we understand the meaning of 'strength of character.’ What do these words mean?

This is going to be a long letter so brace yourself. I am addressing 448, but I will mark a copy to 345 because the process/practice (methodology) are the same, viz.,

 

1. Participant-observation 

2. Symbolic interactionism 

3. Social constructivism, and 

4. Self-reflexivity.

I. Assignment 1: On-going ...

You are developing an 'operational definition' in an on-going experiential manner for each of the 4 methodologies above. 

The skills are known as critical reading and critical writing. It is also known as generative text. 

If you are sent overseas to bring the contract home, so to speak (like Todd Anderson in the film Outsourced), you will need these skills. 

The situation overseas has become Do or Die!

So what’s the assignment? 

1. Google search and scroll each methodology, and 

2. Select One sentence which represents an idea which you want to hold onto for each methodology.

3. Relate your own experience to this idea. 

4. Compare differences (of your sentence selections) with your group and become aware of the Other (please google the term Other). 

II. Assignment 2: Culture as Text

Experiencing culture as text is a buzz phrase most relevant in a digital environment. This paradigm originated in ethnology (please google), the discipline I belong to, where we interpret the term ‘cultural turn’ (please google) by analyzing all kinds of texts as symptoms of culture. A text (in the sense of literary theory) is any object that can be read.

Culture is based on interaction. “To put a text in writing is to place it openly at the disposal of the group as a whole.” In the language of systems theory (please google the term), writing opens “the possibility of assuming the position of a second-order observer, observing, criticizing, and refining, the observational instruments of others.” 

(Please see Niklas Luhmann: “The Form of Writing,” Stanford Literary Review, 9 (1992) p.36

So what’s the assignment?

1. Copy the text spoken in the two films, Moonrise Kingdom and Outsourced (please google). The words spoken in the films are the observations of the writers of these “moving images” and they represent two different cultures.

2. Select 5 sentences from each film which best represents the culture.

3. Reduce each sentence to one word (concept;symbol) which best represents the sentence. You will have 5+5 words in all. 

4. Infuse your felt-experiences for the above concepts. 

5. Compare and contrast your words with those of your group members.

Upshot: Cultural Studies (please google) do not examine cultures, rather, they examine “texts" --- written text from literature to philosophy to videos, films and similar cultural products. The focus is on the underlying attitudes that these “texts” imply: towards the relationship between man and woman, Westerners and Orientals, humans and post-humans, sane and insane, straight and queer folks, etc. What is male, what is oriental, what is human, what is madness, what is healthy, all this can be disclosed as a contingent social construction, a long story that turned out the way it did, but could have gone (m)any other way.

Our logic in the fishbowl that follows from this assignment is easy: if culture is made by society, it can be changed by society. Our constructions culled from the two films can be de-constructed. Cultural Studies in contrast to the study of culture, are texts among texts. They cannot pretend to stand outside the ‘object’ they observe; in fact, the whole distinction between object (the films) and subject (yourselves) becomes questionable.

III. Assignment 3: Copying on an ongoing manner...

Copying is still the best way for Learning and Creativity.

1. Select one sentence from every page in Peripheral Visions, by Mary Bateson

2. Read upto page 16 of Hofstede.

3. Vocabulary

4. Deconstructing and reflecting on Letters. 

Sanjiv

Date: 10/15/2020 11:17:14
Subject: critical thinking skills

Hi Everyone,

The digital world is a textual one and it evokes and generates images. So when I write "How are you, I hope you are well," I create a digital textual world that evokes images that in turn evoke feelings.

How do we survive in a world that has become predominantly digital and everyone and everything has gone online? We are drowning in an endless stream of images that are real and imaginary and they affect our mental structures in dramatic ways.

In such a situation, how do we conduct business with each other.... in simple language and please, only the bottom-line ... "by reading what you have written makes it possible for you to improve what you have already written, while stimulating you and animating you to write what you have not yet written.” Paulo Freire

Critical rereading tells you whether or not you are writing with enough CLARITY. It is in the process of reading and rereading what you have already written that you become better able to write more EFFECTIVELY. We learn how to write when we REACT VIGOROUSLY to what we have written, DISCOVERING in the process that we are able either to improve our writing or to feel satisfied with what we have written.

"Critical reading is a more ACTIVE way of reading. It is a deeper and more complex engagement with a text. Critical reading is a process of analyzing, interpreting and, sometimes, evaluating." 

When we read critically, we use our critical thinking skills to QUESTION both the text and our own reading of it. Such writing gives deep pleasure as much as it has become a duty that we cannot reject, for it is a political project that must be met in order to conduct business. How so? To read critically in the very process of writing redirects our attention to whether or not we have achieved our desired goals. Andrew Bikash (Senior) and I experienced critical writing and reading across sixty letters over the summer during a raging pandemic.

Writing fills all our time as Entrepreneurs. Please see Alyssa Botelho’s excellent example of critical writing.

Sanjiv

PAULO FREIRE (please google)

from the fishbowl...

AlyssaBotelho

Posts: 96

Joined: Mon Sep 07, 2020 5:26 pm

Wed Oct 14, 2020 10:51 pm

Google Search: Rabindranath Tagore

Rabindranath Tagore was a Bengali polymath- poet, writer, composer, philosopher and painter. He reshaped Bengali literature and music, as well as Indian art with Contextual Modernism in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

"You can't cross the sea merely by standing and staring at the water."

This quote reminds me of Professor Dugal's line "those who feel left out or left behind, only the Self can change that condition". We cannot wallow in our own setbacks if we are to overcome them. We've got to make the change that we want to experience. I've found that people romanticize their plans but dread the execution. The magic you're looking for is in the work you're avoiding.

Hi Everyone,

How are you? Your fishbowl postings are on target. Your postings are in the range of B+ to A-.

I. 

The purpose of our postings, like all businesses, is Growth. 

Growth Happens when the Mind Expands and, Growth is Experienced and Felt in the Mind.

Mulling over words and doodling are virtues in the digital world. Everything has changed! 

We are expanding mental structures and creating new mental structures in a textual knowledge economy. 

Our Words are the Elements in these structures.

Our mental structures are subjective and can’t be seen. 

The moment we speak/write, we materialize our structures for the purpose of sharing them. 

Sharing structures has utmost value in an egalitarian society. 

So far, if you are diligent and on top of things in the fishbowl, you are riding an A-.

Just Do It (Nike).

and

This Is It (Michael Jackson).

II.

The more we post, the greater the expansion of digital connectivity. In the fishbowl we are experiencing unprecedented production and use of digital information and this has transformed a host of arrangements among us. 

Our connectivity in the fishbowl has created new kinds of social interactions and social differences. 

For one thing, there is a different character to our interactions. We’ve changed from tight social units to loose social networks and this has affected how we interact and meet each other’s needs. For instance, there are some postings in the fishbowl that are more important for my impetus and inspiration than others, is one example that is universally true.

The point is that old structures are fading and the number of 'networked individuals' is expanding. 

As individuals we are becoming the central actors in social circumstances. 

To be sure, not all people are full-on networked individuals--clannish ethnic, racial, gender, class and local tribes still exist. Yet it is safe to assume that all of us in tightly bounded groups are still connected beyond our bubbles to the outside world by the Internet and mobile apps.

Sanjiv

Date: 9/29/2020 12:59:29
Subject: ASSIGNMENT: Contemplating the Concepts of Beliefs and Values (1)
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone, 

Good morning, I hope you are well.

Your first assignment in 448 is titled: Contemplating the Concepts of Beliefs & Values.

One's beliefs and values are determined by one's childhood and lineage, one’s education and experience, food and music; in a nutshell one's culture.

In 448, we have been looking at the meaning of the words, structures and systems (not so much as yet). 

So cultures have belief systems and value systems, and structures of feelings (please google along with Raymond Williams).

As individual decision-makers, operating in the context of your fishbowls, it would be relevant to ask: what is your belief system? What is your value system? What is the structure of your feelings?

How does one go about answering such questions?

For starters, please develop your understanding of the following words: BELIEF, VALUE, SYSTEM, STRUCTURE, FEELING, CULTURE.

Please make use of the Dictionary, Thesaurus, Wiki, Google Searches, Pictures, Films: mulling and doodling are all grist to your mill.

Please google Raymond Williams.

Belief is indeed subjective truth and so are values and they are like a lens through which we make sense of the world. 

Everyone believes their subjective truth to be the objective truth, and we cling to it firmly, as it determines our self-image and our self-esteem.

Belief and value systems play a key role in business: it determines choices and propels the decisions of buyers and sellers, regulators and shareholders, investors and entrepreneurs, employers and employees, vendors and customers. It determines how we do business, and what ultimately gets done.

So how do we learn to answer the question regarding one’s systems of beliefs and values and structures of feelings?

Stay tuned.

Sanjiv

LENS, SENSE-MAKING, SELF-IMAGE, SELF-ESTEEM

Date: 9/29/2020 1:56:56
Subject: belief&gt;&gt;behavior&gt;&gt;business
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

How are you? How do I say it like I mean it is the question.

In the Fall of 2020, the year of the pandemic, I consider each of you in BUS448, and myself, the Chief Belief Officer of the Future Group, aka, the Fishbowl. 

The idea behind this unusual designation is deliberate and simple: to startle our viewers and make them see the critical role of belief in businesses.

Our job as Chief Belief Officer (CBO) is neither to judge nor change beliefs, it is simply to articulate them. The intention is to expand our minds so that we can see the misalignment between business practices (that are blindly followed) and the beliefs of ‘other’ people (that we remain oblivious to).

When our minds are expanded, we are able to see more frameworks, understand the world better, take better decisions, ones that ensure a viable sustainable and happy business.

Belief is subjective truth, my truth and your truth, the lens through which we make sense of the world, i.e., our fishbowls.

Welcome to our world where our Beliefs determines our Behavior that determines our Business. 

A 3B Framework.

a. My Belief is not measurable but it answers the Why of my Intentions.

b. My Behavior is measurable, and it answers the How of my Task.

c. My Business is measurable, and it answers the What of my Targets.

Sanjiv

I.

oliviagodell » Mon Sep 28, 2020 2:12 pm

My process in understanding this letter:

Bergson: “Duration can only be grasped through intuition and imagination.”

word-pool:

DURATION- the time during which something continues.

GRASP- get mental hold of; comprehend fully.

INTUITION- the ability to understand something immediately, without the need for conscious reasoning.

IMAGINATION- the faculty or action of forming new ideas, or images or concepts of external objects not present to the senses.

reconstruction: the time of which something continues can only be fully comprehended through the ability to understand something without conscious reasoning and forming new concepts and images outside of the senses.

II.

oliviagodell

Mon Sep 28, 2020 2:19 pm

“Construction of phantasms blends cultural ideas and sensory imagination.”

My first thought is to skip over this complex sentence. Then I remember that is what I am here for in the fishbowl- to sift through, deconstruct and reconstruct in a form that is relevant and understandable to me.

construct- form (an idea or theory) by bringing together various conceptual elements, typically over a period of time.

phantasms- a figment of the imagination; an illusion or apparition.

cultural- relating to the ideas, customs, and social behavior of a society.

imagination- the faculty or action of forming new ideas, or images or concepts of external objects not present to the senses.

reconstruction: by bringing together conceptual elements the formation of illusions or figments of the imagination blends ideas of societal behavior thoughts and customs, and creation of concepts of objects not present to one's senses.

Hi Everyone,

How are you? I hope you are keeping well. Mental space is key in these tumultuous (chaotic and confusing) times and discernment the skill to sharpen. Stay with it. Reading about Bergsonism and Phantasmal Media in April Younkin’s excellent sharing below....where ever she may have taken it from.. I want to make sense of these ideas; my point of departure; my stepping out and forward.

How do I do so? How do I construct and create (two separate things) meaning in my textual life is the underlying question, always.

Bergson: “Duration can only be grasped through intuition and imagination.” Wow, that is quite a statement. What does it mean? I don’t necessarily want to know what Bergson meant, as much as what meaning can I infuse into this statement? 

So I look up the following words and create a word-pool: DURATION, GRASP, INTUITION, IMAGINATION. 

I restructure the original statement by substituting words from the word-pool. I don’t know what the outcome of this re-structure will be...I have neither goal nor objective but an inner drive to create something that has meaning to me. This is the driving force in a digital environment that is unknowable and unpredictable.

Please be sure to post this assignment. We take it forward from there. 

Some thoughts for your consideration...

When you finish with the re-structuring, the second statement will make better sense: “Construction of phantasms blends cultural ideas and sensory imagination.”

What is the upshot? Construct and create fishbowls and make them central to your life.

Bergsonism: Philosophy of Henri Bergson

- Duration can only be grasped through intuition and imagination. An image does not have the capability to fully capture duration. Also, we suppress our “elan vital” and manage our lives with logic as we treat new experiences as repetitions of previous ones.

Phantasmal Media: An Approach to Imagination, Computation, and Expression: By D. Fox Harrell.

- Greatly expressive power of computational media arises from the construction of phantasms. It blends cultural ideas and sensory imagination. I have never heard about this before, but it seems very mysterious.

Taking stock: what are we doing?

We are constructing and creating aphorisms, axioms, adages, and abstractions.

Reflection and evocative meditation.

We are reconnecting with positive feelings through our words and images.

We are tapping into memory and pictures and sharing them expressively.

We are structuring and re-structuring words and learning to connect across the aisle. 

Our fishbowl will continue to be grounded in deep learning (google) and, 

the fundamental practice of taking and making notes will be our source for creative action. 

We are not linear but we can be discerned in patterns and layers, 

continuously in motion, shifting, and taking on new forms.

As individuals, we are works of art in progress.

Our feelings are fluid and flowing and familiar.

We explore dimensions that include the gestures, rhythms, and tonalities of self-expression.

We are never overwhelmed because we are trying 

to enhance, to enchant, to express, to entice, never to enforce.

Even our silence speaks.

In the fishbowl, it is not about catching-up but joining-in. 

We are welcomed every time we enter. 

Sanjiv

looking in the mirror 

"Is it ourselves we see, or what we imagine of ourselves? This imagination of ourselves is a mental image of ourselves. It has a word-image to it; a metaphor. The strong can imagine themselves as weak, the beautiful can imagine themselves as strong, a villain can imagine himself as a hero. In the digital sphere, no one can stop us from imagining ourselves in any way. We can be whatever we want. By the same token, you can get whatever you want; but that is another story."

I agree with these statements. In life, you can imagine yourself to be whoever you want to be. You can manifest whatever you'd like in life with putting in the right procedures. Imagination is a strong tool to think about what you like, what you hope for, and endless possibilities to one day accomplish these aspects. Life is important, and so is the ability to imagine. You can only get so far with little to no imagination. I believe the most successful/happiest people are the ones that imagined where they are today at some point long ago.
