Hi Everyone,

How are you? I hope you are safe and keeping well. I thought my generation would escape a world war, but that is what we’re living through.

As soldiers, in the front-line, you know the drill. The drill translates into: Doing Knowledge. Doing it and keeping up with it is the hard part. 

By way of suggestion, please open a Topic in your fishbowls and call it: I Have a Question?

Group members may post their questions under this Topic heading, and in one place. I will be able to address the questions if I can, and so would others.

I always look in the fishbowl by clicking on Active Topics: top right hand side.

It gives me a fair idea as to what is going on in class on a frequent and daily basis.

I’ll be alerted every time I see: I Have a Question.

Here’s what I have learnt.

25% get the hang of it early, after which they are impatient to get to the next step.

25% for reasons beyond their control were out to lunch, and then never really found their way back.

50% are at several stages of development and creativity. Facing Hesitancy and Inflexibility of mental structures.

You have a fair understanding of your process for creating knowledge? 

The basic process is : Deconstruct and Infuse. 

Steps (course of action):

What is the opening structure you selected? 

Do it carefully because the viewer is assessing the sentence you selected? 

After that, you Deconstruct and Infuse, and you want to keep it as short as possible.

What keeps us from doing this as a daily practice? Whenever we do so, we feel good. Please fact check. Same as going to the gym.

Post your doubts and skepticism under I Have a Question. One never takes criticism personally. It is inescapably a matter of misperception and miscommunication. Our difficulties are unique to us in the first place, and then they are universally true as well. We’re all seekers of coherence and clarity...and we got the Steps (course of action)!

Sanjiv

DRILL, COHERENCE, CLARITY, HESITANT, INFLEXIBLE

Look for meaning, not happiness

 Wed Apr 08, 2020 1:54 pm

"In a study of over 1,000 people, 58 percent of respondents reported finding positive meaning in the wake of the Sept. 11 attacks, such as a greater appreciation of life and a deeper sense of spirituality." I was only 2 years old when 9/11 happened and it didn't take me until 9th grade to realize the magnitude of the event. My social studies teacher was the first to really show me and my classmates the true details of what happened on that day through a documentary that must have disclosed every single detail. My teacher constantly emphasized that 9/11 is an event that we must never forget. Not only must we keep in our memories for as long as we live but we must continue to spread the message for generations to come. While I am sure the teacher's main intention of instilling this into us was to make us aware of important historical events in our country and how tragic events like 9/11 happen in the world, I also believe that his intentions may have aligned with the concept that we should be more appreciative of our lives and of the ones we love and use events like 9/11 to make our world a better place and move forward.

I suppose that this pandemic is the first international event that is changing the world every day, and while I am somewhat down about the situation, that I couldn't celebrate my 21st among other things, and just see friends and family in general, I am making the most of it and doing what I can to be a better person, such as building my knowledge creation abilities through reading and posting in the fishbowl, until the world settles back down.

Letter Title: Awareness of one's world (448)

"Your postings open thresholds between you and the others in the world. "These thresholds are silences.”

"If your silence does not remain present and active, your fishbowl loses its most important function: communicating and not merely transmitting information"

In the above sentences lies the true function of the fishbowl. If it weren't for the fishbowl, many of my fellow classmates would not have ever read my work, and vice versa. This is the threshold we pass every time we post, through breaking our silence. We've moved passed sitting in a class room where there is not enough time for everyone's opinions and ideas to be heard and shared. We are operating in a forum that breaks down those barriers. Everyone is free to interpret and convey what they please and we are not bogged down by anything but our own level of engagement. In the fishbowl we are sharing, creating, interpreting and communicating our beliefs and thought processes and gaining a collective understanding of ourselves and each other. We are breaking down barriers in communication and presenting our understanding to one another. We're all working through concepts, values and ideas, trying to make sense of them individually and at the same time we are able to see someone else's interpretation which then adds to our individual understanding. SOCIAL REFLEXIVITY.

Date: 4/7/2020 20:05:12
Subject: summarizing the final (443)
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

Summing up your 4 Projects:

Each project will render the following structures:

Opening Structure: 1

Individual Re-structure: 3

Joint Structure:1

Total Structures developed: 5.

Grand total for 4 Projects: 5 x 4 = 20

DIchotomies: Dichotomies are made from your perceptual categories.

Your dichotomies, i.e. 2 words, represent a complex relationship that you are investigating.

You do so by constructing a structure that holds ELEMENTS of both words.

You gathered elements by focusing on the words, i.e, taking them further into the dictionary, in order to make a considered selection.

Every project will have nine felt experiences. Each individual will have shared 3 which includes the last paragraph called Realization and Insight. Both these words have to be understood by you before you write the paragraph. Go to the dictionary and write them out.

You will give me the following on the last day of class:

1. The Group’s list of 20 Structures and Dichotomies.

2. Individual’s selected 15 words from above

3. Distribute the 15 words above, into 5 boxes: 3 words in each box. Two inside and one outside. 2+1, five times. You’re doing this individually. You are constructing a design.

4. YOu will write 5 sentences, one for each box. Each sentence made from 2+1 words. ALways take them further.

Finally, You will share your designs and create a Group Design. You will tweak your design models and come up with a Group FInal Design. One that you are all comfortable with.

ALL OF THE ABOVE HAS TO BE POSTED BEFORE APRIL30. ON THAT DAY I WILL GIVE YOU A NEWS ITEM FOR YOU TO IMPLEMENT YOUR DESIGN. IT WILL BE A GROUP PAPER 3 PAGES, DOUBLE SPACED. MORE ON THAT LATER.

YOUR FINAL GROUP PAPER WILL BE POSTED IN THE FISHBOWL ON THE DAY OF THE EXAM, IN MAY SOMETIME.

ANY QUESTIONS SHOULD BE POSTED IN YOUR FISHBOWL UNDER THE TOPIC: “I HAVE A QUESTION” AND I WILL ADDRESS IT THE MOMENT I SEE IT. I SEE IT BY CLICKING ON ACTIVE TOPICS REPEATEDLY. 

Sanjiv

ps: treat it like it is: a word game. Doesn’t take long. Be true to yourselves. As you develop your word game, I will be filling in the theory until the day of the exam.

Subject: Reflexive Methodology for a Knowledge Economy (443)
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

I hope you are well. I feel bad that circumstance will cheat you out of a graduation ceremony and celebration, and much else. 

Your efforts in your fishbowl shows the viewer that leadership and constructing knowledge comes from your reflections. We are looking at the future of your mental spaces and creative consciousness (critical phenomenology, please google).

In a digital environment, you are developing different uses of reflexivity or reflection which typically draws attention to the complex relationship between processes of knowledge production and the various contexts of such processes as well as the involvement of the knowledge producer. Please see Sophie Vicedomine's posting below.

In simple words, in your work environment, you will be paying much attention to how one thinks about thinking. Yours has to be a reflexivity that constantly assesses. A reflexivity that constantly assesses the relationship between “knowledge" and “the ways of doing knowledge’. Your postings are woven together in the process of knowledge development. Your fishbowls are constructing, interpreting and writing empirical material.

As a knowledge worker in a digital economy, you will be asked, HOW do you know something and WHY?

Please be certain as to what you are doing. Looking at my last letter to you,... we are maintaining the belief that the study of suitable (well thought-out) excerpts from any particular reality (like Fromm) can provide an important basis for the generation of knowledge that opens up rather than closes, and furnishes opportunities for understanding rather than establishing “truths.”

I will be writing to you about the 10+1 in 443. I have given you an opening syntax, if you check your notes, but I will do so again in the next letter. You are all doing fine in the course. Don’t doubt yourself. In the fishbowl, even silence speaks. We have the entire April to finish the 4 projects. You have to begin to “look" at each other. It was never meant to be between you and me. 

Please google Marta Calas & Linda Smircich, 

and, Mats Alvesson & Kaj Skoldberg.

I love these people. I owe them, for they have taught me much.

Sanjiv

Re: letter reflections

Mon Mar 30, 2020 6:08 pm

Thought as production, not as access

Thought - an idea or opinion produced by thinking, or occurring suddenly in the min

Production - the action of making or manufacturing from components or raw materials, or the process of being so manufactured.

Access - a means of approaching or entering a place. an attack or outburst of an emotion

I've fallen off the horse a bit recently in the fishbowl. The strange newness of no structure in my everyday life at first was fun, and a bit freeing, but as the days passed in a cycle of my ever-shifting sleep patterns and strange meal times, I realized it was bogging me down. It took me a bit to come back to the sense of community and to find it in an online platform. It is really easy to feel overwhelmed with everything going on, but the fishbowl has at least stayed constant in the changing syllabi of other classes.

I looked up the concepts of Om and Indra's net, and it inspired me to delve into new areas of knowledge and knowing that I've never experienced before. I'm familiar with some similar concepts in my practice of yoga, but I know my knowledge about those things is surface level.

I know what I bring to the table - a strong sense of purpose and an ambition that drives me. I am incredibly persistent when I am inspired, and it is part of my responsibility as a student to find the most interesting niches of every subject.

Date: 3/29/2020 22:48:28
Subject: embedded in each other's text (443 &amp; 448)
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

How are you? I am invariably thinking of you... I am thinking of the future ... making meaning. My RESOURCES are the text and images that I generate. 

I woke-up early and worked on the concept and word: Hope. The thought came to me in the middle of the night to LINK the word with Eric Fromm (please google).

This connection between the word Hope and the writer Eric Fromm is a choice, and a SELECTION that came to me in the middle of the night. Add I felt good and comfortable about it. It is where my IMAGINATION and KNOWLEDGE intersected. After that, when I woke in the morning, I took the word HOPE further and linked it with being HUMAN. 

All my connections and selections and juxtapositions are inspirations from your postings. What does it mean to be human and to have hope?

What does it mean to me when I read your postings. What do I feel? Thank you for showing me.

Well how do I go about answering the question: what does it mean to be human?

WHERE do I start, and after that WHAT do I do, and HOW do I do it?

1. I have to FIND a syntax. I have to find a structure with which I will enter the unknown regarding the question: what does it mean to be human and to have hope?

2. I FIND the following syntax from Eric Fromm's, The Miracle of Hope.

"To be human is to be a miracle of evolution conscious of its own miraculousness — a consciousness beautiful and bittersweet, for we have paid for it with a parallel awareness not only of our fundamental improbability but of our staggering fragility, of how physiologically precarious our survival is and how psychologically vulnerable our sanity. To make that awareness bearable, we have evolved a singular faculty that might just be the crowning miracle of our consciousness: hope."

"Hope — and the wise, effective action that can spring from it — is the counterweight to the heavy sense of our own fragility. It is a continual negotiation between optimism and despair, a continual negation of cynicism and naïveté. We hope precisely because we are aware that terrible outcomes are always possible and often probable, but that the choices we make can impact the outcomes."

3. I selected sentence structures from his book. KEEP IT SIMPLE, ALWAYS. The best structures are generally found in the Introduction. Gives you perspective, distance and choice whether to go ahead with reading further. That is always the question in every RELATION that you are developing: should we take this FURTHER? Is there POSSIBILITY between us. Do we have POTENTIAL? I’m talking of your relation with words.

4. Now DECONSTRUCT and INFUSE.

So proceeding with the task at hand...what does the word human mean?

"To be human is a miracle of evolution

conscious of its own miraculousness.” Wow!

I better look up “miracle” and “evolution”. I did. Wow again.

Type them out.

One’s “awareness" of things, like online words, is everything.

Wow. Look up AWARENESS and type it out, it is everything in the digital sphere.

The digital world is a different kind of space. It is VIRTUAL. It is MENTAL. It is IMAGINARY. We’re experiencing it. Corona brought it to our awareness. But it happened in the most tragic of ways. 

When the fishbowl was formed in the 1990s by a group of us, we were ahead of the curve and have been practicing it ever since. Just got lucky hanging around the right people. Europeans mostly. We discovered through study the differences in critical thinking between Germans, French, Scandinavians and the Brits. The Italians and Spanish too. The influences just go on and on. This summer I’m going to crack the text of Peter Sloterdjik. I can’t wait! Last summer was my first shot at it. You gotta return!

Regarding the birth of the fishbowl I have to acknowledge the work of three students who were my peers in every respect and colleagues: Matt Roy, Matthew Eriksen and Kathy Mallon. We had intense relations, for we were bringing forth the 10+1steps and breaking new pedagogical ground. A lot of battles and wars, mostly with Administration. It was another time at URI, definitely worthy of a movie.

Getting back to the syntax...

“A consciousness beautiful and bittersweet, and we paid for it with a parallel awareness of our limitations and precariousness.

To make this awareness bearable, as humans, we evolved the faculty of Hope.” Wow!

Looked up faculty. To EVOLVE the FACULTY of Hope.

Hope is that we will take wise and effective action in every crisis, like Carona.

Hope is the COUNTERWEIGHT to our fragility.

Counterweight in the dichotomous sense. 

A continual negotiation between the dichotomies: optimism/despair, and negation of the dichotomy cynicism/despair.

Wow, wow and wow. Please pause and see the impact of creating dichotomies.

I have hope that the choices you make in the digital world, like you are making in your fishbowls, will have the same impact in the outcomes in your life.

THANK YOU! Please see Maia Weltman’s posting below.

Sanjiv

ps: it is going to get heavy. Just absorb it all. You know your home works are different in the two courses. The key is to listen to me and Just Do It. It is never difficult, and I will always show you how to do it. The Steps. But you have to make the Selection and the Creation. At the most basic, you are creating dichotomies and building from there. Don’t get wrapped up about the A and letter. You already got a foot in the conference. That’s impressive in the digital world. So long it gets accepted. The last date is April 2 and then the review begins. Until then we can edit it. Write to me if you have any concern.

from the fishbowl...

2. I FIND the following syntax from Eric Fromm's, The Miracle of Hope.

"To be human is to be a miracle of evolution conscious of its own miraculousness — a consciousness beautiful and bittersweet, for we have paid for it with a parallel awareness not only of our fundamental improbability but of our staggering fragility, of how physiologically precarious our survival is and how psychologically vulnerable our sanity. To make that awareness bearable, we have evolved a singular faculty that might just be the crowning miracle of our consciousness: hope."

"Hope — and the wise, effective action that can spring from it — is the counterweight to the heavy sense of our own fragility. It is a continual negotiation between optimism and despair, a continual negation of cynicism and naïveté. We hope precisely because we are aware that terrible outcomes are always possible and often probable, but that the choices we make can impact the outcomes."

3. I selected sentence structures from his book. KEEP IT SIMPLE, ALWAYS. The best structures are generally found in the Introduction. Gives you perspective, distance and choice whether to go ahead with reading further. That is always the question in every RELATION that you are developing: should we take this FURTHER? Is there POSSIBILITY between us. Do we have POTENTIAL? I’m talking of your relation with words.

4. Now DECONSTRUCT and INFUSE.

So proceeding with the task at hand...what does the word human mean?

"To be human is a miracle of evolution

conscious of its own miraculousness.” Wow!

I better look up “miracle” and “evolution”. I did. Wow again.

Type them out.

One’s “awareness" of things, like online words, is everything.

Wow. Look up AWARENESS and type it out, it is everything in the digital sphere.

The digital world is a different kind of space. It is VIRTUAL. It is MENTAL. It is IMAGINARY. We’re experiencing it. Corona brought it to our awareness. But it happened in the most tragic of ways. 

When the fishbowl was formed in the 1990s by a group of us, we were ahead of the curve and have been practicing it ever since. Just got lucky hanging around the right people. Europeans mostly. We discovered through study the differences in critical thinking between Germans, French, Scandinavians and the Brits. The Italians and Spanish too. The influences just go on and on. This summer I’m going to crack the text of Peter Sloterdjik. I can’t wait! Last summer was my first shot at it. You gotta return!

Regarding the birth of the fishbowl I have to acknowledge the work of three students who were my peers in every respect and colleagues: Matt Roy, Matthew Eriksen and Kathy Mallon. We had intense relations, for we were bringing forth the 10+1steps and breaking new pedagogical ground. A lot of battles and wars, mostly with Administration. It was another time at URI, definitely worthy of a movie.

Getting back to the syntax...

“A consciousness beautiful and bittersweet, and we paid for it with a parallel awareness of our limitations and precariousness.

To make this awareness bearable, as humans, we evolved the faculty of Hope.” Wow!

Looked up faculty. To EVOLVE the FACULTY of Hope.

Hope is that we will take wise and effective action in every crisis, like Carona.

Hope is the COUNTERWEIGHT to our fragility.

Counterweight in the dichotomous sense. 

A continual negotiation between the dichotomies: optimism/despair, and negation of the dichotomy cynicism/despair.

Wow, wow and wow. Please pause and see the impact of creating dichotomies.

I have hope that the choices you make in the digital world, like you are making in your fishbowls, will have the same impact in the outcomes in your life.

THANK YOU! Please see Maia Weltman’s posting below.

Sanjiv

ps: it is going to get heavy. Just absorb it all. You know your home works are different in the two courses. The key is to listen to me and Just Do It. It is never difficult, and I will always show you how to do it. The Steps. But you have to make the Selection and the Creation. At the most basic, you are creating dichotomies and building from there. Don’t get wrapped up about the A and letter. You already got a foot in the conference. That’s impressive in the digital world. So long it gets accepted. The last date is April 2 and then the review begins. Until then we can edit it. Write to me if you have any concern.

from the fishbowl...

Sharing Felt Experiences

- Right now I believe that myself and many of my peers are frustrated. We are frustrated because we are all going to be graduating and entering a time where the job market may possibly be at its worst. We are all trying to do our best to finish up our degrees knowingly that there will be no graduation. We are frustrated because we didn't get a last change to say good-bye to fellow peers or professors, or thank you's! I may have not even gone to my last class for all I know, and maybe I wouldn't have paid any attention anyways...

But now I feel frustrated. This is rather sad for all of us, professors included. We had plans, visions, and excitement for what was to come and now we are face with uncertainty day by day.

With that being said, I am going to do my best to communicate with you all more actively and emotionally in the fishbowl.

HEARTBEAT

TO WHOM IT MAY CONCERN

I am happy to write this letter of recommendation for XXXX. She successfully completed my course on International Dimensions of Business (BUS 448). 

XX is an excellent student and earned an A in the course through her academic ability, diligence and hard work. She displayed a superior ability to articulate complex concepts and apply them into various contexts, readily and effectively. 

XXXX reached a high level of achievement in constructing ‘meaning’ when communicating across different cultures. She led her group in one project by developing a complex interactive communications system that was extraordinary in its effectiveness, versatility and potential. XX also displayed an innate ability to discern the subtle yet critical cultural elements of the class in various contexts. She listens, with genuine interest, to new ideas and questions. XX’s caring attention was surely the basis for her group’s continuing curiosity and desire to learn.

XXXX is one of the most outstanding students I have had the pleasure of teaching, and I believe strongly that she has the intellect, personality and ambition that will allow her to be successful in pursuits she chooses to undertake. 

Ms. XXXX will be an asset to any educational institution. She is particularly suited to pursue further studies and professional opportunities. I recommend her with great enthusiasm for this opportunity.

Introduction:

We present a heuristic device for ‘reading’ and ‘writing’ in the context of online sharing. Our paper presents a new kind of sharing between reader/writer or author/viewer that transmits a social imaginary and puts into play active humanistic participation. We are 120 participants (students at the University of Rhode Island) presenting the ‘way’ in which we made possible the formulation of our text and its subsequent transformation into knowledge. In other words, we’re presenting the ‘manner’ in which we produced categories and concepts for ordering, organizing, and transmitting knowledge among ourselves. In so doing, we realized the more we “immersed” ourselves in something, the more we “connected” to universal principles and processes. The deeper we went, the farther we could see all around. In our simulated world, The Fishbowl, looking carefully at anything informed looking at everything, creating a surrounding sensory feeling of immersion and humanistic participation.

Our purpose is twofold. To present the ‘way’ we deployed attention to text and, the ‘way’ in we formed ourselves into a cohesive group. There is large variation in attentional practices among us, ranging from rigid to flexible. Our overarching purpose as a group was to manage new digital spaces and produce valuable knowledge for the participants.

Our paper presents a process and practice for socially constructing reality by using a reflexive methodology. Over a period of 12 weeks we combined real and virtual environments and human-machine interactions to create an experiential learning. Operating in groups of three, every participant in The Fishbowl is visible upon entry. We were looking at ourselves, looking at ourselves.As participant-observers, we interacted by projecting symbolic word-structures; creating abstractions through dialogism and reflexive practices.

Method:

We collapsed the differences between readers and writers by providing continuous edits and modifications, becoming ‘embedded’ in each other’s text. Our paper offers a more controlled format for producing an equivalent to Wikipedia.

Multiple and deliberative authorship calls for an equivalent form of reading, one that is not a re-reading but instead, a reading ‘anew’ each time. As Readers creating their own meaning, we were adding our own authoring to the text. In this way, we became a living “real time” process of simultaneous reading and writing, producing, evolving and having diverse patterns of meaning.

By shifting attention to focusing on the meaning of words, we constructed a knowing and a feeling among ourselves which helped connect in personally significant ways. Simply, we set up a heuristic for ‘deconstructing’ word-structures and, we extended our reality of the deconstructed text by infusing individual felt-experiences.

Outcome:

Our heuristic device helped us imagine, create and deliver innovative experiences. It enabled immersive learning, reduced time spent, while increasing engagement and ability to mirror real-life situations. By following the practice of carefully looking at every word, our “writing” became a process of self-interrogation motivated by a concern for the group.

So what:

Immersive learning is still emerging as a practice in the workforce, but it’s clear that given the broad range of employee-training services, understanding concepts of ‘augmented reality’ and ‘extended reality’ technology will be critical to the enterprise of the future.

Keywords: VIRTUAL COMMUNITY, IMMERSION LEARNING, HUMANISTIC PARTICIPATION

Hi Everyone,

I sense an anxiety regarding grades and grading.. 

There will be three categories: A, A-,B+

The number of posts plus quality of posts will together determine your category.

Your assignments are designed for you to work together, generate text and create a knowing which is expressed in the final.

A fourth box which is a straight B is always possible. 

Basically looking for evidence that you know what you’re posting about.

You’e competing with each other and, your number of posts and knowledge content are visible to everyone. 

That is the advantage of being online. It is a digital world and a visual culture, where we can be seen and even our silence is visible. 

You will be giving the grade to yourself. You are stepping into the box meant for you, because we can see each other.

We are Eyes looking at Eyes.

If you give the grade to yourselves, then what am I evaluating is the question.

The Abstraction with your Authorship, written particularly for those who get an A with a testimonial from me. 

There’s no fudging when it comes to the A. It must be earned and revered.

NIck Colicci’s reflection below looks like an A to me. Wouldn’t you agree? It is fascinating in its complexity and earnestness.

For your Text to be owned by you, it has to be worked upon. It is tough business in a tough economy. Fifteen minutes a day, keeping the thread is all that is required.

A lot of staring at blank screens and pages. We are soldiers going forth into the unknown. Same as the present crisis.

Sanjiv

nickcolicci

Email Reflection

Thu Mar 26, 2020 3:43 pm

I have wondered often how I am doing in this course and if I am going to get an A. I think I am doing quality work and abiding by the necessary guidelines to achieve an A. However, it is important not to get caught up in the letter grade that I will receive. It is most important that I focus on learning and improving my intellectual capabilities. I look at this way: when I interview for law school or a job, will explaining how I got an A get me in with scholarship? Or, am I more likely to impress someone by explaining the steps and processes I took to improve my learning and expand my mind? I figure the second one is the better option. This is not to say an A will not help, I just believe having depth and meaning is more impressive and better suited for leaving a mark on a university.

I am trying to tell my story in a simple way that allows my peers to understand me and reach me. I am trying to understand each letter, vocab word, or Google search in terms of how it applies to my life. How have I been conditioned? What has made me who I am? What can I do to better myself? These are all ideas I keep in mind when I dedicate time and effort to the fishbowl. It is important to keep a mission or goal in mind when pursuing a task or an accomplishment. It tends to keep me honest and on track. I post as often as I can because I want to stand out as a student and a person. It is my competitive attitude that is driving me to work this way. I am enjoying the process and I am enjoying the potential benefits it will yield in the future. I will not give up until I earn an A and the letter of recommendation that will place me above those I am competing with.

Date: 3/26/2020 13:02:46
Subject: Fwd: BUS448
------------------------------------------------------------
Dear Yasir,

Thank you for your email. 

You must listen to me with an open mind. 

What does that mean? 

You must interpret my words from my point of view. 

Deconstruct & Infuse is the mantra for the process we’ve been following in the course. As an example, I’ll SELECT your last three sentences in your email below, and pull out the following phrases for deconstruction:

scholarship can stay; 

know your thoughts; and, 

appropriate approach.

Next, I will go to the dictionary and look up the meaning of the words: scholarship, stay, know, thought, appropriate, approach.

I’ll write the meanings out.

Next, I will substitute my original words, from the words I got from the dictionary, for better understanding as to what I want to convey.

The above part is your abstract expression. Google Abstract Expressionism.

Next, infuse an example of an incident and a felt-experience from your life that represents your abstraction. It has to fit. Content and Form.

If I were to do that, I would 'tell the story' of Professor Linda Smircich who read my four page paper and wrote: “This is not acceptable.” 

In one sentence, my status as a doctoral student was threatened. It took me the entire year to re-write the four pages, because I was unable to listen. And I lost my BFF Carey McDonald because she couldn’t stand my inability any more.

The approach in 448 is non-linear. It is subjective, it is participative-observation, symbolic interaction and social reflexivity. These are methodologies and you are having difficulty in understanding them. Google them and pull out one sentence for each and hang your cap on it (metaphor) for the semester. That should be easy. I am being clear, concise, objective and structured. So Just Do It!

So far we have had a glimpse into four cultures (Japan/Australia; Lola/Charlie Boy). We’ve been watching their intersection from a business point of view (bringing the contract home) and the inevitable problems that arise. We’re gaining skills experientially in our groups in the fishbowl. That is what all the postings you are reading and wondering what is expected from you. You’re learning to generate text, and in plain language it is called sharing stories. You’re learning to share in a meaningful way. Impactful. 

448 went online 21 years ago and so did 443. How come? I read the book! (Same as Hiromitsu in Japanese Story). What the pandemic has changed for us is that you have to watch the movies alone. Class in real time was only for movies.

One could say that you have paid for this course to learn something not to sit around and share stories. Well, we’re trying to understand how Charlie Price’s shoe factory went global. How did he get online? By telling his story. 

At the moment, we are understanding Culture by telling stories (generating text and images) and we are proceeding in a particular way as described above. To get the coveted A and a letter of recommendation, you have to respond to as many letters as the next guy. You can do it, but the question is can you focus. What I mean, can you take a word further and dwell on it? If you can, then you are the teller and I am the told. That’s how you want it to be, if you want the A.

For this week, please see Moonrise Kingdom and Outsourced in that order. Write out the script; the words spoken. Like I have done above. After that, you will deconstruct and infuse, in order to understand culture, first your own, and then the others in your group. We’re trying to understand the word culture and what it means to be American.

You’re looking at each other in your groups. Follow the scent and keep your nose to the ground (metaphors).

Sanjiv

Subject: cosmic perspective (443 &amp; 448)
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

Your felt-experiences are testimony to the assertion that 'information will never replace illumination.' Your felt-experiences awaken our environmental conscience and pioneer a new aesthetic of writing and thinking about the poetic truths radiating from the facts of physical reality. With an eye to the consciousness-reconfiguring cosmic perspective, we find solace by taking a more telescopic view — not merely on the short human timescale of one's own life, but on having lived through a pandemic and having felt-experiences on far vaster scales of space and time. Please see Andrew Bikash’s posting below.

You mirror what is best of humanity back to itself in the middle of a pandemic, at a time when we seemed to have forgotten who we are to each other and what it means to share this fragile, symphonic moment. Amiel Lopez turned 21 the other day as well!

I don’t think it is possible to contribute to the present moment in any meaningful way while being wholly engulfed by it. It is only by stepping out of it, by taking a telescopic perspective, that we can then dip back in and do a felt-experience which our time asks of us. Please see the posting below as an example.

Sanjiv

ILLUMINATION, TELESCOPIC, PERSPECTIVE, COSMIC, CONSCIOUSNESS, RECONFIGURE, AESTHETIC, POETIC, TRUTH

andrewbikash

Impact: sharing felt-experiences

Wed Mar 25, 2020 7:21 pm

While it is sad that we have to deal with these unfortunate, extraordinary circumstances at such an inconvenient time, it is important to remember that it is just a phase that will be over soon. While our routine has shifted from going to class during the week and going out socially on the weekends, it is vital to not replace that routine with no routine such as doing nothing all day. By looking on the bright side of the situation and embracing the new way of life, we are benefitting ourselves not just now but even for after things are back to normal. The new routine should consist of extensively creating knowledge because isolation provides an environment perfect for developing intellect. This environment provides a level of quiet that we don't get to experience often.

I turned 21 this past Sunday but I was not able to go to a bar or even a restaurant like everyone else does on their 21st birthday because everything is closed. However, I did not let this bring me down because I got to enjoy my birthday in a way that most people don't experience their 21st: simply with immediate family. In fact, I enjoyed the day because it was so simple yet meaningful because I was able to do simple things like walking my dog and eating dinner with family, but with the addition of birthday wishes which honestly made me appreciate the people in my life and not take them for granted. If I were to celebrate my birthday at school, it would have been much different because I probably would have gone out with friends, would have had a much more social experience, and wouldn't have enjoyed the milestone moment of my birthday as much I did. Although I will never be able to experience the 21st birthday like everyone else, very few people will experience a 21st like mine. This is part of my singular story which I embrace and I will continue to make the most out of what I have.

Hi Everyone,

We're often told that extraordinary situations require extraordinary responses.

I’ve often wondered about it.

When two people meet, there are four things on the table: you and yours, me and mine. 

When yours is exchanged for mine, it is a transaction. 

When who-I-am impacts who-you-are, it is a relationship.

By sharing felt-experiences, we not only inform but impact each other's lives. Impact cannot be predicted nor measured. It is subjective and felt. Please see Kyra Solomon’s felt-experience in the fishbowl.

Sanjiv

IMPACT, INFORM, EXTRAORDINARY, SITUATION, RESPONSE

Reflection: Creativity Takes Work

 Wed Mar 25, 2020 11:51 am

When was the last time you felt liberated?

Ironically enough, I think it was when I came home for spring break. I was feeling very burned out from school at that point, and I couldn't wait to get home and take a break. Then, I would go back to school and get to enjoy the last stretch of my college career with the friends I loved and the campus I'd come to call home. But that never happened. The next time I got to go back to campus would be to collect my things, standing six feet away from everyone who passed and avoiding getting in the elevator with others. There is no liberation here. There is only grief, loss, fear and frustration. My father lives in New York City, at the country's epicenter of the disease. I don't know how long it's going to be until I can see him again. My mother has an autoimmune disorder and is a chronic smoker. I'm so terrified of anything happening to her. My maternal grandmother is 82 and lives a block away from me, and yet for her own safety I can't see her. My paternal grandparents are in a senior filled community in Florida, a potential tinderbox. If I can just get through this without losing anyone I care about, I promise I'll never take anything for granted again. I miss large, joyful gatherings of people. I miss game nights with friends. I miss hugging people I love. I hate this, and I feel trapped and helpless. There is no liberation here.

Date: 3/25/2020 14:37:35
Subject: creativity takes work (443)
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

How are you? I hope you are safe. It is a time of rest, a slowing down, and getting closer to one’s body and not so removed from it. Looking at the notion of mind-body connection and asking, what do we mean by that?

Well, to answer such questions, or any questions we choose to frame, you must first remind yourselves, touch base (metaphor), as a ritual and practice, as to what you are doing together in a fishbowl. 

You are creating a design that ‘represents' your fishbowl. You are critical thinkers and you have an audience who is looking at your creativity in the fishbowl. 

What is creativity?

Creativity is the ability to cast a situation or challenge or problem in a new light and thereby open up possibilities in it that were not evident before. It is precisely what you are doing in your fishbowls. Please fact check your projects. You should be on your second one by now.

Creative people are critical: they don’t stop with the “given” and the (supposedly) “obvious.” They are imaginative: they make a habit of thinking in more open and supple ways, keeping their minds two steps ahead of things as they are. They are inventive: they consciously seek to devise new things and new ways of thinking.

And creative people are disciplined and persistent. Creativity can require a certain kind of playfulness, but it does not mean just letting go. Creativity takes work. Please see Lea Janz’s posting in her fishbowl.

The two paragraphs below are an example from my creativity and criticality regarding producing value for your fishbowl. It has to be of worth to myself in the first place...

a. When was the last time you felt liberated? How does one go about answering such a question. The feeling of Liberation must connect both my mental/physical state (dichotomy). Feeling good is simultaneously, mental and physical. Every time I feel good, I feel liberated. That’s a structure of words right there. Every time I feel good, I feel liberated. You breathe life into the structure by infusing a felt-experience. You empower your text in that way. Not doing so is the main shortcoming and struggle for each of us.

Here’s more for a felt-experience: every time I connect mind/body I feel liberated. 

b. Dichotomies: Mental/Physical; Objective/Subjective; Material/Abstract; Universal/Particular; Theory/Practicum...and whatever dichotomies you are creating in your projects. I always look forward to seeing what you got. What are you presenting; how are you thinking; what are showing and saying and telling and representing? It doesn’t have to be black/white. Your singularity rests on your choice of dichotomy (word-images). Be wild and brazen, you have nothing to lose but over-represented structures.

Bottom line: work your project(s). It is human, it is universal, it is particular, it is general, it is focused, it is flexible, it is forever ongoing...

Sanjiv

LIBERATE, MIND, BODY, DICHOTOMY, REPRESENTATION, SINGULAR 

from the fishbowl...

Re: Reflections-Lea Janz

 Mon Mar 23, 2020 6:35 pm

'om' is known as the most sacred mantra in Hinduism or Buddhism. It is a combination of Atman (soul) and Brahman (reality, truth). In our fishbowl, we are extracting words from text, from reality, and infusing our soul. We are practicing this idea on a daily basis whether we know it or not. As a result, we feel more at peace with ourselves.

Speculative Realism by Graham Harman

speculative-based on theory rather than knowledge

realism-based on facts, acceptance of reality

We should start to see our thoughts as tangible products. Thoughts contain components of our feelings and our reality.

As I have noticed recently, we avoid talking about our feelings because it makes us seem vulnerable, but the best way to connect to people and to reach inner peace is to be comfortable with being uncomfortable. This means talk about your childhood, your heartbreaks, your sadness, and your happiest memories.

Looking at Indra's net: holographs, every point contains a bit from all other points. It is a metaphor for reality. We are all unique jewels in the net that reflect off one another, no two are the same, but no two are entirely different. I suppose this is an example of not knowing what people are going through, so treat them with kindness. To add, treating people with kindness does have an impact as we all are reflecting from one another. In a way, I feel that I am learning how to freely rotate myself to experience alternative realities, shine on each other, and grow from reflections.

Date: 3/24/2020 22:14:21
Subject: connecting across systems (448)
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

I’m forever wondering whether I'm writing too many or too few letters.

 

Your fishbowls are theatre (metaphor). You can choose your own metaphor. Your fishbowl is on a stage and the play is between the three of you. Each actor is writing their own script. It is a space for performance. You’re giving monologues as in theatre and acknowledging the Other’s presence. It is a literary device. You are trying to create value in visual space. It is about your audience and not market share, as Charlie Price discovered. If you remember, Charlie and Lola spoke in abstractions and monologues out in space, but to each other, nonetheless. Think about this some.

It’s just a metaphor. We lead symbolic lives. I don’t want you to be anxious but joyful. Let your fishbowl be a playpen.

You are creating value by connecting across your symbolic systems in your fishbowls. Symbolic systems can’t be seen but they manifest as text.

Connecting across? Symbolic systems? Cultural? Can’t be seen?

How so? Please be specific, clear, and give steps.

Well, here it is the steps: In the next week please stream the following two films:

1. "Moonrise Kingdom," by Wes Anderson. Please google him. My favorite director. Wes Anderson shows us fundamental American values and he is good at it. 

In the film you see American values as a symbolic system. 

First step: Your assignment is to be an observer and copy the words spoken by the protagonists, Sam, Suzy and the others in the film. Every phrase spoken is a manifestation of an unseen symbolic system. 

Second step: And then, to cross check with your own experience as an American or as an outsider.

2. “Outsourced," with Josh Hamilton and Ayesha Dharker. Todd Anderson from an American symbolic system parachutes into another symbolic system: India. How does he survive?

Next, I am working on an assignment from Hofstede in Ch. 2. I’m going to lead you into his research. We have yet to get to the bottom of all this: value systems and belief systems and symbolic systems. How do we decipher them? Are they quantifiable and measurable? 

The films will serve as a backdrop. So you will have got several world-views and symbolic systems going on. There was Japanese Story and Kinky Boots was not completed in one section, so please stream it. I believe these films are mainstream and easily available. They might cost you something. We’re trying to understand concepts and theories underlying cross-cultural situations and, at the same time, how to make money and succeed. Please be sure to keep this in mind. How do we create value in cross-cultural situations? How did Charlie and Lola, and Sandy and Hiro do it? What does it take? How do I go from being a small-town operation to being global.?

We’ll be grappling with such issues. Your assignments will be part of it. Hofstede’s dimensions is something we are getting into the next few days.

Please see Nick Colicci’s posting below. His text is a manifestation of his symbolic system; his value and belief system. Sharing thoughts is an act of courage and a sign of leadership. The fishbowl has several leaders and we would not be the same without them; we’re forever grateful.

Immerse into it. It’s all in your head. You are learning by osmosis and doing your vocabulary is the key. Don’t rush it when you do it. Enjoy the films. If you are not enjoying your learning, then we have to re-group. Pursue words and thoughts and images. Capture them. Make text.

Sanjiv

MONOLOGUES THEATRE (wiki)

Staying Tuned

 Tue Mar 24, 2020 3:10 pm

There was a lot of information to unpack in this letter. My mind was going all over the place and I was not sure really what to focus on as I evaluated the content and details Sanjiv included in each line. I started with the opening paragraph and evaluate the concept of not thinking at all. Do not overthink. This is certainly something I wish I had embraced growing up and as I transitioned into college. Not overthinking would have helped me to limit anxiety or any fears I had for the future or the unknown. I think it is something we all could work on and take the time to reflect upon. While that runs contrary to my previous sentences, we need to think a little before we do not think at all. However, in a time of the coronavirus, we could all benefit from letting our instincts go and instead take a step back to relax and prevent the spread of a virus.

My background undoubtedly is a narrative that influences the story I am writing on a day to day basis. The notion of service is the foundation of my life and the career I am trying to pursue. It motivates me to work hard and overcome any challenges that may be viewed as a roadblock or an impediment to my progress. This is what I have in mind as I write in the fishbowl; my work should be reflective of something larger than myself and instead focused on how my efforts can contribute to the well-being and growth of others. I do not want to waste my life and intelligence on the money I have the potential to make. My story needs to be larger and more impactful.

The difference between us as people is what perpetuates progress and development. Similar to 443 and 448, I view social change in the 1960s as reflective of deconstruction and infusing. Figures such as Martin Luther King Jr. and John Lewis stood for equal rights because they deconstructed and infused the challenges they faced into real-world movements. It was monumental and it caught the attention of those in power and spurred change. The differences between those in society and those who were not afraid to speak their mind led to an essential change in society, albeit hundreds of years too late. We must continue to read the posts of others to ensure we are not overlooking imperative ideas that can benefit the community. I fully believe we are powerful and have the potential to spur change in the community.

The rest of the letter was somewhat overwhelming and full of content I have been thinking about so far this semester. However, I pulled the importance of having an audience, working every day, considering the needs of others, and speaking to my story/culture. The amount of work to complete by the end of the semester is a lot and it is not allowing me to relax or take a load off. However, I will keep pushing to ensure I do not fall stagnant in this time of challenge. I will continue to post in the Fishbowl, research for my other classes, and study for the LSAT. I will work with the audience I have an ensure I follow the story of my life. I will continue to listen to others and recognize the needs/desires of them to ensure people do not fall behind. I am excited for the next chapter and what is next on my journey.

Date: 3/24/2020 14:17:19
Subject: staying tuned (448)
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

I think about 443 and 448 most of the time, or I don’t think at all. It doesn’t mean I am not informed about external news. 

It is the “don’t think at all” part that I must extend. I realize this thanks to the coronavirus. 

I got something out of it! I guess it is what yoga must be like, but I’m no advocate. It’s why we admire sportspeople, artists and performers. 

My upbringing was British-Colonial and my philosophical influence was Sikhism and Indian upper-class. It is a whole other story. Far removed from my American story. 

It is always about our stories, and we develop their text and images as we write to each other. It is helpful to have a face or two in mind. 

It’s all in the mind, fleeting and ephemeral (short-lived) images and the act of visualizing text, i.e., imaging words. This requires focus. 

Our task, our labor is to capture images and take words further. 

For instance, what is my image of the word Mother? What is yours? That is the Difference between us. And so it goes.

Indians will always bring up The Mother. How many children do you have is the first question they will ask. The cow is a national cultural symbol because she nourishes the world with milk.

 

Difference is what you’re doing in your fishbowls. This is basic to both 443 and 448. 

Once you take difference into account, then it is a matter of repeating the process of evoking ever more differences. 

So most of you (some more than others) have got the algorithm down: deconstruct and infuse. That’s what we’re calling it this time.

 

This is how I understand and interpret Deleuze’s work on “Difference and Repetition”. Heavy stuff. Please google. You have to keep returning to its text until you get the hang of it. Please see https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AUQTYlCTfek

Writing as a daily practice in order to communicate, to tell where your mind is at, is essential to being a leader. We need expressive and convincing leaders who work the text. Transparent and Authentic performance. I am talking about businesses of every size and composition. It is a level playing field (please google Thomas Friedman). To survive, you need an Audience. Without an audience is like winking in the dark. We seek viewers and not customers. We work for an audience now, not market share or market niche. This is clearly depicted in the story of KInky Boots, and was the talisman for Charlie Price’s Shoe Factory. You have to hand him that, whether you like him or not. (I think Lola had complete disdain for him, and she took pity on the poor sod). I’m just a Charlie Boy moved from being a small town business, enamored by a money-minded real estate agent, to becoming a global phenomenon. And Charlie Boy took everybody with him. 

How did Charlie Price do it? Can you do it? How would you start? Something to think about.

The text you generate will SPEAK to your fishbowl’s culture. I am aware that you are uncomfortable with this learning approach. Every one is. 

"No more map” is a refrain between us and Sandy and Hiromitsu. There is an intersubjectivity and intertextuality developing among us.

You are learning to be technologically savvy: being conceptual and abstract in a symbolic world of simulation.

Friendship knows no map, except the one you create in the moment. We learnt that from Sandy and HIromitsu. They had to drop their national cultural structures (geisha girl and big bums) and start from ground zero. That is your starting point. That is the purpose of the friendship exercise. There are students from the previous semester who have done the exercise and they can describe their outcomes. There has to be transparency and authenticity. These are the keys to understanding culture. It is why Art is so important. Art is an authentic feeling expressed in a particular medium.

In 448, you are exploring the differences in thinking and social action that exists between the three of you. You are assuming, like Hofstede, p.27, that people carry “mental programs” (word-structures) which are developed in childhood and reinforced in schools and organizations and, our mental programs contain a component of national culture. That is, we interpret the same word-image differently and this difference is on account of our national heritage.

Please be cognizant of this.

More to come so stay tuned. I need to give you some writing assignments and ask you to watch a couple of movies. These are important to study because otherwise, you wont see the significance of the theory behind your actions when deconstructing and infusing. The course is built for the three of you. It is a thinking, texting and imaging course. It is learning to communicate with three people from your workplace. You are engaged with each other in generating text among yourselves and for your benefit. At the end of the semester, after you are said and done, show the copy to your employer and ask for a raise, or else! 

You are selecting, substituting, editing, copying, changing, replacing, adjusting, adapting, all in the moment. Focused and Flexible. 

Whenever you pick-up and take advantage of what I try and get across, your response in your fishbowl is pretty fantastic. Learning is an act of courage. It is literally stepping into the unknown. We are all experiencing this in the digital world.

“In every repetition some thing different occurs” (Deleuze) Please see Joseph Penhallow’s posting below.

Sanjiv

DIFFERENCE, REPETITION, INTERSUBJECTIVE, INTERTEXTUAL, HERITAGE

Connecting across cultures whenever we allow ourselves -

"Attitude is everything. And it is the only thing entirely in your control."

Your attitude dictates your work ethic, productivity, relationships, and success because attitude is your worldview. I think this also stems to the concept of accountability. You are accountable for your attitude because at the end of the day you are the only one with a say in it.

Group Dynamics -

"You have to get the process down"

The process Sangiv is referring to is listening in class (not anymore), taking notes, reflecting on your notes, learning and posting your vocabulary, reading and processing Sangiv's letters, posting your reflection, interacting with one another.

------------------------------------------------------------
Date: 3/15/2020 20:09:15
Subject: the rise of the digital (443 &amp; 448)
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

Your fishbowl has a "digital culture which is made up of communication and information exchange modes (emails and postings) that displace, redefine, and reshape knowledge into new forms, formats, and the methods for acquiring and transmitting such knowledge.” Please google “Digital Cultures” by Milad Doueihi.

Please pause and be sure you understand this abstract definition of your fishbowl’s culture.

This definition is useful because it allows us to perceive directly something we experience implicitly all the time. I am talking about what you feel and what you see and what you do. You are who you say you are.

I believe the relationship between the writer and the reader has changed. Please see Amiel’s posting below. We write now for posting and projecting our thoughts onto our universe for whomsoever picks up the signals (like this response to my universe) and in this way, whole ecologies emerge, come into existence and disappear.

Watch the film "Completely Unknown" with Rachel Weisz and Michael Shannon. The caption reads, “You are who you say you are.” 

Sanjiv

PROJECT, UNIVERSE, SIGNAL, EMERGE, ECOLOGY, DISAPPEAR

CONNECTIVITY

Post by Amiel » Sun Mar 15, 2020 3:50 am

#49

Why do we emphasize the 'generation of complex relation' over 'stability of objects'? We stress the 'generation of complex relation' to develop connectivity and to embrace it. The 'generation of complex relation' is what I see as the "production of complicated concepts" and the 'stability of objects' is what I've come to understand as the "firmly established feelings". These come hand and hand in our journey to address the how, what, and why. But one takes precedent over the other. The generation is our movement of critical and creative making. Movement before establishment must be at the fore. The interactivity that we so radically shift to requires movement. The transition of movement, perception, and sensation is combined with connectivity. But the connectivity does require the establishment of feelings, it's an adjustment that is impacted by situational circumstances. External shocks in the global economy such as the current Pandemic situates itself as a turning point for the case in establishing online connectivity. With employers seeking to utilize remote work to mitigate loss and risk it's a solution that may suit the situation but may test a level of effectiveness. Business Continuity does not require a common meeting place but in reality a common understanding. As the more we practice remote work the better we get at implementing a skill that we will need to constantly improve. It is innovation at its core. The underlying complex relation is this new way of selecting our words when we're not physically present. We need to be able to communicate effectively with out speaking or physically seeing each other. Mistakes in communication are made too frequently in today's messaging formalities. Being able to build understanding amongst our different choice of words is invaluable. In times where we might not understand, it is upon us to ask the necessary questions and uncover all meanings so we can formulate moving images. An effective leader doesn't need to be seen as it is his words that will be understood by the masses. The connection of our texts is the place where we left off. We are not perfect human beings but this is where we come to improve our skills. The Fishbowl has allowed me to interact more frequently with an area of business communication technology that I didn't initially understand. But now that I receive letters almost daily I'm trying to understand the complex structure that Professor Dugal communicates to us. I want to be able to understand the complex relations that a global workforce encompasses. This is the open mindedness of different meanings and abstract ways of being that we have to accept and navigate. We work differently and we all have differences but finding common ground is what a transformational leader strives to achieve by seeing the reflections and responses among his 'equals'.

Date: 3/14/2020 23:35:18
Subject: connectivity (443 &amp; 448)
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

There are several things that have to be addressed among us in the fishbowl. 

First and foremost, I hope you are well and safe, along with those who are connected to you.

We are in this together. 

What does that statement or word-structure or sentence mean for us?

After physical distancing ourselves and repeatedly washing our hands, How do we connect in a meaningful way that is joyful and abundant?

How do we connect?

What do we connect?

Where do we connect?

When we address these questions, 

we radically shift our idea of interactivity 

towards an ecological conception of the term.

That is to say, we emphasize the 'generation of complex relation' over the 'stability of objects'?

Your postings in your fishbowls reveal the creative potential of movement (what word did you select), perception (what word did you see) and sensation (what word did you feel). Our connecting has to do with the art of critical and creative making. Please see Nick Colicci’s posting and the notion of connectivity in this light: movement, perception and sensation.

Sanjiv

ECOLOGY, INTERACTIVITY, CONNECT, GENERATE, COMPLEX, RELATION, STABILITY, OBJECT

nickcolicci

Posts: 286

Joined: Wed Jan 22, 2020 9:40 am

Contact: Contact nickcolicci

First draft

Fri Mar 13, 2020 11:59 pm

After reading through the first draft of the abstract, I believe Sanjiv's words truly embodied our course and the progress we have made along the way. "Our paper presents a new kind of sharing between author/reader and writer/viewer that transmits a social imaginary and puts into play active humanistic participation. We present a heuristic device for ‘reading’ and ‘writing’ in the context of online sharing that is egalitarian, horizontal and non-hierarchical." This line, in particular, explains the overall structure of the Fishbowl. In addition, I believe it reflects the recent transition I have made to a baseball coach; I am no longer the student of the game, rather an instructor to those looking to get better. I am able to structure an environment to match that of the Fishbowl, one where there are expectations but no strict guidelines or feelings of hierarchy. I want each player to feel they have an equal chance to play and succeed regardless of their personal backgrounds and experiences. I want to foster an environment of humanistic participation and ensure every student is comfortable asking questions when needed.

"By following the practice of carefully looking at every word, our “writing” became a process of self-interrogation and selecting symbols, motivated by a concern with the personal and cultural implications for the group." I believe one of the most important concepts that I pulled from this course was that of self-reflection. I have learned to evaluate my opinions and standing in life as a means to understand where my strengths and weaknesses lie. By understanding my weaknesses, I know how best I can make contributions to my organization and ensure I am being as productive as possible. Understanding my weaknesses allows me to focus on improving the parts of my personality that are not useful. Without this course and the encouragement to reflect on who I am, I would not be able to grow and develop to the extent that I capable of.

nickcolicci

Posts: 286

Joined: Wed Jan 22, 2020 9:40 am

Contact: Contact nickcolicci

Creating meaning and significance

Sat Mar 14, 2020 12:12 am

"When you write from a place of truth (your selection of words)..." In posting in the Fishbowl, I do my best to be genuine and honest with the words and phrases I construct. I learned from a previous relationship what happens if you do not speak from your heart. This relationship was very faulty; there was poor communication and was often very passive-aggressive. Not knowing where we stood ultimately led to the premature demise of what could have been a successful companionship. I try to keep this experience in mind as I post and work in the Fishbowl. I do not want to waste anyone's time or ruin any sort of relationship/ line of communication that has great potential.

In a trying time in our society, in which the community is impacted by a disease that is tracking quickly across the glove, we are left to fend for ourselves. We are also left to rely on those around us for support when we have nowhere else to look or we are not strong enough to rely on ourselves. I took a hiatus from the Fishbowl this week as I traveled to Florida to visit family and was constantly aware of the situation around me. However, I used this trip as an opportunity to help my family members who are not able to do the daily household work themselves. This reminded me of the work we are completing in the Fishbowl. This is not to say that there are members of the Fishbowl who are not able, but the work I complete is intended for others who may be stuck or confused. I believe in being committed to the Fishbowl, we are placing the needs of others first and providing support in times of turmoil and uncertainties.

Top

nickcolicci

Posts: 286

Joined: Wed Jan 22, 2020 9:40 am

Contact: Contact nickcolicci

Re: Letter Interpretation

Sat Mar 14, 2020 12:12 am

When I heard all classes would be online after the extended spring break I was nervous for all but two classes: BUS443 and 448. In these two courses, we have become familiar with online learning and we have embraced the Fishbowl as our primary source of education and development. We were well prepared to move away from our in-class meetings and instead concentrate our focus solely on the Fishbowl. This is a pretty interesting and exciting prospect; more time to take ownership of learning and less time parking, riding the shuttles, and walking to classes. I must also keep in my mind, however, that I do have other classes and work responsibilities to tend too. Life goes on despite the pandemic.

I am fortunate to have my name listed on the abstract and to have had the opportunity to contribute to its development by being active in the Fishbowl. This is a very unique opportunity, one that is not readily available in other courses. Does the time and research I put into the papers for my political science class ever get published simply by my active engagement? No, it does not. That is why I am happy to have been enrolled in this course. I look forward to taking the skills I have learned and developed over this semester into my summer job, fall coursework, and ultimately my future career endeavors. My path and progression are only beginning! I need to capitalize on all the opportunities available to me.

This reminds me of the opportunity I had playing in a baseball tournament in Nashville, Tennessee when I was 15. I initially thought it would be the typical trip for baseball I always went on, but it turned out to be much more. I fell in love with Nashville and realized I wanted to pursue a career there. I met and bonded with incredible people that I most likely never would have had the opportunity to interact with. It taught me to be grateful for all the events in our lives, even if we do not expect them to be great. This is the Fishbowl at the current point of my life. The little things turn out to be more invaluable and impactful than originally expected.

Date: 3/13/2020 13:18:47
Subject: update on the abstract (443 &amp; 448)
------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone,

How are you? I hope you are keeping well. 

Last night I submitted the abstract. Most of you are co-authors. A handful of names didn’t make it to the list because there was little evidence of using the heuristic by them. More on this later. The abstract is a tighter version of what you have been reading and working in your fishbowl. I had to cut down to 3500 words and deleted some poorly framed phrases. It is never-ending labor. Depends on your ambitions and what motivates. There are endless possibilities to take your text further. 

Everyone and everything is going digital and we have something to show and tell: stay close to text.

Please feel free to contact me if you need to. Email and/or Providence, Shepard bldg. I am following you in the fishbowl and will now shift my head out of the abstract into the task at hand. Your learning is not going to skip a beat. BUS443 and BUS448 have been online and in the making from the last 20 years. 

Sanjiv

ps: This morning, the last date for submitting the abstract has been extended to April 2. There is time for those who must increase their postings and reflections.

from EDULEARN20

IMMERSIVE LEARNING: HEURISTIC DEVICE FOR TRANSMITTING SOCIAL IMAGINARIES

S. Dugal1, N. Colicci1, A. Bikash1, A. Weston1, L. Janz1, N. Katchen1, K. Bugbee1, T. Martinez1, L. Denicola1, L. Cardono1, M. Degnan1, A. Roberti1, O. Palumbo1, K. Solomon1, S. Wordell1, B. Bolofsky1, T. Mulligan1, A. Lopez1, C. Morganelli1, B. Matarese1, K. Jensen1, A. Sullivan1, B. Mulligan1, D. Jones1, N. Amodio1, M. Augustine1, K. Fasano1, R. Forte1, H. Mecca1, V. Volpe1, M. Oppliger1, T. Ritacco1, M. Boelter1, M. Bowman1, C. Chen1, M. Pelisson1, B. Nong1, S. Costello1, P. Costanzo1, Z. Buckley1, K. Naranjo1, E. Lis1, D. Ayrassian1, J. Milder1, Y. Aloshban1, J. Repoza1, M. Fuhrman1, R. Kattan1, C. Hladick1, D. Brysch1, S. Vicedomine1, M. Volpe1, M. Troiano2, R. Singh3, S. Singh4

1 University of Rhode Island (UNITED STATES)

2 Clearheads Films (UNITED STATES)

3 RL Studio (INDIA)

4 Savvy Matters (UNITED STATES)

sanjivdugal@uri.edu, ncolicci@my.uri.edu, andrew_bikash@my.uri.edu, aydan_weston @my.uri.edu, lea_janz@my.uri.edu, natalie_katchen@my.uri.edu, kevin_bugbee@my.uri.edu, tiana_martinez@my.uri.edu, lea_denicola@my.uri.edu, lauren_cardono@my.uri.edu, michael_degnan@my.uri.edu, alexroberti@my.uri.edu, olivia_palumbo@my.uri.edu, kyra_solomon@my.uri.edu, samwordell@my.uri.edu, brooke_bolofsky@my.uri.edu, pmulligan@my.uri.edu, amiel_lopez@my.uri.edu, cmorganelli@my.uri.edu, bimmer105@my.uri.edu, kayla_jensen@my.uri.edu, andrea_sullivan@my.uri.edu, brady_mulligan@my.uri.edu, dawson_jones@my.uri.edu, nicholas_amodio@my.uri.edu, matt_augustine@my.uri.edu, kyra_fasano@my.uri.edu, raisaforte@my.uri.edu, hamzamecca16@my.uri.edu, vincent_volpe@my.uri.edu, moppliger@my.uri.edu, thomasritacco@my.uri.edu, matthew_boelter@my.uri.edu, madison_bowman@my.uri.edu, cchiehyu_0915@my.uri.edu, mpelisson@my.uri.edu, branden_nong@my.uri.edu, shancostello3@my.uri.edu, paige_constanzo@my.uri.edu, zachary_buckley@my.uri.edu, kylenaranjo@my.uri.edu, eli_lis@my.uri.edu, david_ayrassian@my.uri.edu, juell_milder@my.uri.edu, yasir_aloshban@my.uri.edu, jacob_repoza@my.uri.edu, mfuhrman@my.uri.edu, ramakattan@my.uri.edu, chladick@my.uri.edu, dominik_brysch@my.uri.edu, svicedomine@my.uri.edu, mary_volpe@my.uri.edu, michael.troiano1@verizon.net, rahoulsingh@gmail.com, shivsingh@gmail.com

Introduction: 

We present a heuristic device for ‘reading’ and ‘writing’ in the context of online sharing. Our paper presents a new kind of sharing between reader/writer or author/viewer that transmits a social imaginary and puts into play active humanistic participation. We are 120 participants (students at the University of Rhode Island) presenting the ‘way’ in which we made possible the formulation of our text and its subsequent transformation into knowledge. In other words, we’re presenting the ‘manner’ in which we produced categories and concepts for ordering, organizing, and transmitting knowledge among ourselves. In so doing, we realized the more we “immersed” ourselves in something, the more we “connected” to universal principles and processes. The deeper we went, the farther we could see all around. In our simulated world, The Fishbowl, looking carefully at anything informed looking at everything, creating a surrounding sensory feeling of immersion and humanistic participation.

Our purpose is twofold. To present the ‘way’ we deployed attention to text and, the ‘way’ in we formed ourselves into a cohesive group. There is large variation in attentional practices among us, ranging from rigid to flexible. Our overarching purpose as a group was to manage new digital spaces and produce valuable knowledge for the participants. 

Our paper presents a process and practice for socially constructing reality by using a reflexive methodology. Over a period of 12 weeks we combined real and virtual environments and human-machine interactions to create an experiential learning. Operating in groups of three, every participant in The Fishbowl is visible upon entry. We were looking at ourselves, looking at ourselves.As participant-observers, we interacted by projecting symbolic word-structures; creating abstractions through dialogism and reflexive practices. 

Method: 

We collapsed the differences between readers and writers by providing continuous edits and modifications, becoming ‘embedded’ in each other’s text. Our paper offers a more controlled format for producing an equivalent to Wikipedia.

Multiple and deliberative authorship calls for an equivalent form of reading, one that is not a re-reading but instead, a reading ‘anew’ each time. As Readers creating their own meaning, we were adding our own authoring to the text. In this way, we became a living “real time” process of simultaneous reading and writing, producing, evolving and having diverse patterns of meaning.

By shifting attention to focusing on the meaning of words, we constructed a knowing and a feeling among ourselves which helped connect in personally significant ways. Simply, we set up a heuristic for ‘deconstructing’ word-structures and, we extended our reality of the deconstructed text by infusing individual felt-experiences. 

Outcome: 

Our heuristic device helped us imagine, create and deliver innovative experiences. It enabled immersive learning, reduced time spent, while increasing engagement and ability to mirror real-life situations. By following the practice of carefully looking at every word, our “writing” became a process of self-interrogation motivated by a concern for the group.

So what: 

Immersive learning is still emerging as a practice in the workforce, but it’s clear that given the broad range of employee-training services, understanding concepts of ‘augmented reality’ and ‘extended reality’ technology will be critical to the enterprise of the future. 

Keywords: VIRTUAL COMMUNITY, IMMERSION LEARNING, HUMANISTIC PARTICIPATION
